Reviews.Title: Excellent features, price and quality photographs!
Reviews.Author: Savvy shopper "Andi"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchase the Nikon Coolpix L20 after lots of shopping.I have used only Olympus cameras only up to now.This time I wanted a smaller pocket sized camera, that still took the AA batteries, and that still gave great photos with all the features I was used to.This camera fit the bill!It takes 2 AA batteries, inexpensive SD memory cards and yet still delivers fantastic photos.I have already tried all the features, and was completly happy.I love using the different scene settings, and could not live without the video feature.Both still and video capture worked well in both bright light and low light.The sound playback via the camera is hard to distinquish (live music), but fine once uploaded.I didn't really require the smile feature, but tried it out on my 3 year old, and was blown away....it really works!The blink feature is also quite ingenious.  The camera actually asks you if your subject blinked when they do, but not when they don't.  This is particularly handy when taking photos of children.  I would have loved this feature when I was still my daughter's yearbook photographer.What can I say, fabulous price and awesome quality!!!Definately worth the money.Comparibly priced camera's that we have used, produce grainy shots.....but have not found this with this camera at all.I would recommend this camera to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Unless you need a really long-lens telephoto and billboard sized prints, this is the perfect camera for every use
Reviews.Author: C. Scanlon "least helpful reviewer"
Reviews.Content: This is a professional camera capable of crystal clear prints worthy of publication or gallery display, up to 16x20.And it is incredibly inexpensive for a camera of such value.Ok, so its 3.6 optical zoom won't pick sand off an eagle's beak at a thousand yards. Okay, so it won't blow up to billboard size without loss of definition. In the real world however and everyday use this is a fine and professional level camera that will do a far better job than you expected. Better than a cell-phone.Disguised as a point and shoot. That's what makes it very effective; people are not intimidated by it. You can get right up to them, and it looks like any other camera. Yet, it is more.In fact, the generous three inch LCD screen means you do not have to hold it to your face. There is no optical viewfinder in any case. So you can hold it at your hip and glance down at it to compose, and snap shots while engaging the subject in small talk comfortably. I have done this effectively with Tarahumara Indian children in northern Chihuahua who normally run quickly from any camera. It works, and came out great. And that large LCD screen has a high-contrast, anti-reflection coating which keeps it clear even in strong sunlight.This camera is an improvement over the earlier, wonderful Coolpix, such as the great 8 megapix Nikon Coolpix L18 8MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Ruby Red) mainly because it has ten megapix capability. The earlier accessories such as the AC adapter, the  Nikon EH-65A AC Adapter, are transferable if you have a long shoot to do in one place (like a schoolful of children, which I have done) or other reason to go off-battery. Nevertheless, a pair of Energizer® e<sup>2</sup>® "AA" Lithium Batteries For digital cameras, portable audio players, and more last in here last forever.Your old Coolpix camera pouch also still fits; use it and protect your investment. I like the Rokinon Compact Digital Camera Padded Carrying Case for Canon Powershot, Casio Exilim, Fuji Finepix, (GE) General Electric, Kodak EasyShare, Nikon Coolpix, Olympus FE Stylus, Panasonic Lumix, Pentax Optio, Sony CyberShot and Samsung Digital Cameras.Also new here, aside from the greater megapixels, is the new Expeed image processing system specially fine-tuned for the Coolpix series "to render natural-looking pictures of incredible quality and quick response" as if the earlier system of digital processing was not fine enough! Amateur enthusiasts will find their photos reaching a new magnitude of quality; even the professional will leave his camera bag and lenses at home (okay, so she might miss her long lens, but macro here gets in to two inches).The ISO settings are phenomenal, stretching from 64 ISO all  the way out to 1600. Over twenty years ago when I was doing photo-journalism in Nicaragua, we used 64 for our slide film and 1600 was just coming on the horizon, very grainy but with a special charm for low light situations, like oil lamp, etc. Here you can do very low light and candlelight  (if you do not mind some grain effect), and in fact there are special pre-sets which employ the faster ISO's effectively.This is another expansion over the prior Coolpix L series. You can choose instead of Auto (with own its user-selected options) to use the pre-set "Scene" selections quickly and efficiently. The Scene modes now include: Portrait, Night Portrait, Sports, Landscape, Party, Beach/Snow, Sunset, Dusk/Dawn, Night Landscape, Museum, Fireworks Show, Close Up, Copy, Back Light, Panorama Assist, Food. Food is one of the new ones, and you food photo-journalists might want to try it very inexpensively yet quite well here. The rest of the modes you can figure how they are set from the title and how you might apply their settings to similar situations; know that the Nikon impression of party might be much more sedate and candle-lit than the Animal House idea. This is not cheating, to use pre-sets; this is using the tool that you have in the way it was designed. Cheating would be setting this to its auto-scene setting in which it selects the Scene mode according toprevailing conditions, automatically. Yes, this can do it.The panorama assist is great. You can take a series of photos in a row in either of four directions (left to right, up and down, etc.) overlapping by one third (I really appreciate the rule of thirds grid which you can bring up on the LCD, keeping the camera straight and well composed), and then unite them with the included software into one long (or tall) file. I had reason to do this the other day at a long new school. Things do not build vertical out here in the desert, but there is plenty of room for horizontal, and a special Cinerama style long photo framing. In fact you could line up your whole town along the sidewalk standing and take one long photo of everyone in town. Just find printer and paper!With the built in macro mode you can jump right into that cactus blossom from two inches away and have perfect focus. Take a photo of that baby's toes and blow them up to 16x20. Come in close to that ant stealing cracker crumbs on your picnic. This strength of macro was recently unimaginable, and yet here you have this power within a humble, tiny and inexpensive package.What I really love and appreciate is the SDHC compliancy. I can use as standard memory card a regular Sandisk 4GB Secure Digital SD HC Memory Card (SDSDB-4096, BULK, No Reader) and have room for 500 shots at maximum resolution. You can truly, as we used to say a quarter century ago "shoot a roll; keep a shot."  Take all of the shots you can, and then pick one out to use and delete the rest. For someone who used to burn through boxes of film (at 36 shots each max) and then do the darkroom processing all night, and then find a free way to get more, this is like living in another, finer dimension. Of course, you can put even larger SD HC memory cards in here and if you ever do fill one up and have nothing more to put in there and no time to delete, this camera comes with a generous 20MB internal memory on hand.You can hook it up to the USB port of a computer directly and use the included software, or simply pop out the SD card and plug it into a reader and into the computer. Whatever works for you, although I do not like opening and closing the battery/card hatch too much. It is very strong and durable, but in the olden days I had a habit of snapping such things and putting them back together with duct tape. This one looks remarkably resilient nevertheless and has stood up to me.Speaking of shooting a roll to get the one picture, have you ever taken a shot to discover your subject blinked? This camera lets you know. Yes, this camera sees when your subject blinks, and lets you know, using the Smart Portrait system. It also automatically fixes your red-eye special. You'll never see red eye again. It finds faces, and automatically focuses on them, up to a dozen at a time. It can also snap the shutter automatically when someone finally dares to smile. And the D-lighting will save those details otherwise lost in darkness.As you can see, this camera does everything for you but serve as photo agency selling your work to Vogue or GQ. A great camera at a small price. What can go wrong?The most amazing thing for me, of course, an old still shooter, is that this tiny camera is also a video camera, with built in mike, and a built in speaker for playback. You can make movies with this at two different resolutions, either for television playback at 640x480 or laptop at 320x240 (good for e-mailing). These home movies are truly sharp, with the same excellent back to front focus as the photos, and surprisingly high quality sound. The length of the movie is limited only to the size of your SDHC card; you could easily go for feature length! Using .AVI files, it can easily be edited as well.Of course, this camera comes with the standard sized screw input for mounting on a tripod. I have used it on my Targus 66-inch heavy-duty tripod. Looks a little small up there, but it works great. You will really appreciate the steadiness a tripod always brings, and the freedom, no less with this great camera, which so thoughtfully has a tripod screw-in.Hey, for the same price, this is way better than a cell phone!Too bad this one is so, well, red!

Reviews.Title: Decent Starter Camera
Reviews.Author: Jerry D. Finley
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife when her Olympus Stylus 300 had run it's life expectancy. May it rest in peace. The Nikon Coolpix is relatively easy to use.. has lots of decent features and the price was killer, but.. picture quality isn't as good as her late Olympus or the Canon Sureshot we also use. However.. It is worth the money. In hindsight I wish I'd spent $50-90 more and got another Canon Sureshot. The picture difference is noticeable. Me thinks this Nikon would be perfect for a child or teen learning to use a camera and NOT seeking hi-end results. My 2 doubloons.

Reviews.Title: a little misunderstood
Reviews.Author: E. Quinanola
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I don't usually make reviews here (a little too private). But I couldn't help but come to the rescue of this highly misunderstood product. Too much negative reviews for a product that actually delivers, IMO. I bought this item as a gift for my 11 year old daughter. Then when I looked at most of the reviews here, my heart sank. Should I have researched more? But being that hard headed as I am. Plus I don't like the headache of returning things, that I have already bought. I investigated more and really tested this product. First off, I noticed that mostly first time camera users seemed to have no problem with this camera (like a reviewer's fifth grader here or a grandpa). So what seems to be the problem? Okay, I found out this - most of us have been used to other digital cameras where you half pressed first on the shutter to focus before you press all the way and shoot. Well this camera has what you call an easy auto mode - wherein the camera does everything for you including focusing. With easy auto mode, it is just that - easy - just point, camera does it's job and shoot right away. Let the camera focus for you (it actually makes a sound) and once it does that then just shoot away. Don't even half press anymore and "wala" - very sharp pictures that even a fifth grader and grandpa could take. I have found out that in easy auto mode and then I half press to focus or don't click right away after the camera focuses - pictures come out so blurry. But, wow! Just follow what I say and the pictures are so sharp. The camera also has the standard auto mode, wherein you could half press first to focus (if you're used to that), and the pictures still come out so sharp. So there you go, this camera I highly recommend and is a good point and shoot camera that takes really sharp pictures. Don't believe me? Investigate for yourself and just follow what I did...

Reviews.Title: A Jewel of a Camera
Reviews.Author: Josh C. Duyal
Reviews.Content: Contrary to the first commentor (I believe he had a defective product from the onset) I love my new L20. A jewel-like body containing every important feature one needs to take excellent pictures. And what a beautiful video capability that camera has! Very smooth, can zoom in during shooting and has long recording capability. Everything works just as advertised. The pictures are brilliant with correct balance of color intensity vs. sharpness and contrast. The Easy Auto feature is powerful and works every time to compose the right scene correctly. I love this camera - highly recommended especially at the price range it's being sold. I think it's underpriced.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For a Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Kristyn
Reviews.Content: I owned a Nikon Coolpix (an earlier model) for about ten years (constant use) until I finally wore it out and needed to replace it.  When I bought this one, I immediately fell in love with it.  It produces sharp, clear pictures and could not be easier to use.  It has a nice, big preview screen which gives you a very good idea what your picture will look like.  This camera's settings allow you to take good, clear pictures of almost anything - sporting events, plays, birthday parties, evening functions, etc.  I cannot say enough about how terrific this camera is, and the price is amazing.  I would recommend it to anybody without reservation or restriction.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for low price
Reviews.Author: Pamela S. Flick "bearygardener"
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix L20 10MP Digital Camera with 3.6 Optical Zoom and 3 inch LCD (Deep Red)I have found the L20 to do quite well for a low cost camera.  Excellent features, easy to use, great photos. Love the raised holding area for a firm grip.  This was my primary reason for purchasing this model as I tend to drop things.My only change would be for this area to have a rubber grip, but not everyone needs a rubber grip, or any at all.  Great color and terrific zoom and macro qualities.  I did some shots in heavy wind and most turned out even though I was being blown around causing movement.  My husband and I both bought this one as he is a truck driver and often photographs from a moving truck.  Would make the same choice again.

Reviews.Title: very nice
Reviews.Author: Make The World A Better Place
Reviews.Content: I do a lot of backpacking, so for me, size and weight are crucial issues (I still remember the old days of lugging around either a digital camera or a camcorder, because they were too heavy to take them both). Until recently, I was using a small point-and-shoot Polaroid 7MP for still photos, and an RCA Small Wonder to shoot 640x480 video (I shoot for the Web, so I can live without high def). Both worked well for what I needed, but the limited one-hour recording time for the Small Wonder was ahuge (but at the time unavoidable) annoyance--it required that I carry along an ASUS PC EEE netbook (which is also, by the way, a wonderful little machine) to download all the footage every time the camera got full.  So a few weeks ago, when some shmuck stole my fanny pack containing my Small Wonder (and a bag of raisins), I decided to use it as an opportunity to consolidate some things and save myself some weight. So the critera I set for a replacement camera was (1) had to do both video and still photos, (2) had to be able to use SD cards for storage so I wouldn't have to carry the ASUS laptop with me anymore, (3) had to be as small and light as possible, (4) had to use AA batteries instead of lithium-ion, and (5) since I'm poor, it had to be cheap cheap cheap.The Coolpix L20 fits all those.Some of the other cameras I considered, and the reasons why I rejected them:The Flip. Nice video camera, but it doesn't do stills, and the built-in non-expandable 2hr recording limit would be crippling for me. I was getting tired of lugging that ASUS around with me all the time. I'd much rather carry around just a couple SD cards.The Vado HD. This one does both photo and video (both standard VGA and 720p HD), and has 8G of internal memory, giving it more recording time than the Flip.  I liked it. But it was important for me to have an expandable storage capacity, and the Vado doesn't take cards. It also uses a lithium-ion battery, and I wanted something that used AA's. So I had to rule it out.The Kodak Zi8. This really looked like a great camera, and I considered it very very carefully. It has almost everything I wanted (and real 1080p High-Def, to boot). It alllmmmooosssttt went into my pack. Ultimately, though, the reason I rejected it was because it uses a lithium-ion battery instead of AA's.  For most people that probably wouldn't be a problem (although it might be a problem that the Zi8 costs twice as much as the L20). For me, though, AA batteries were a necessity, since I use a solar panel to charge the camera in the field, and finding a AA charger that will work off a solar panel is easy, but finding a lithium-ion charger that works with solar is not easy at all. There is also the advantage that, no matter what flyspeck of a little town I might happen to wander into off the trail, I can *always* find AA batteries somewhere if I need them. It's just worlds more convenient to be able to use readily-available rechargeable AA's instead of proprietary lithium-ion. And of course it's better for our Mother Earth, too.So I went with the Coolpix, and have not regretted it. Is the photographic or video quality as good as a pricey high-end model?  Nope. But it's pretty darn good. Unless you're a professional photographer shooting for National Geographic or something, this little camera will do everything you need to do, especially if you use a mini-tripod. As for the video, if you want super-sharp broadcast-quality high def, then this ain't the camera for you.  But if you just want to shoot video of your vacation or your kids for YouTube, FaceBook, or email, this will do the job admirably.My only real concern was how well it would stand up to being in the wild for extended periods of time. So far, though, my worries have been groundless.  Although I try to protect it from rain, mud, sand and dust as much as I can (ziploc baggies are a backpacker's friend), it's still gotten a pretty good amount of abuse with me, and came through just fine. It even got accidentally dropped once with no ill effect (something I don't recommend you try for yourself).Of course I realize that most people probably don't have the specific requirements for a camera that I did.  But if you're just looking for a good basic video/still camera, with the convenience of readily-available batteries, this one is pretty hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Lisa Miller "firstgrandma"
Reviews.Content: I researched alot of cameras to get just what I wanted. This is definitely it. The price was great. I got everything I wanted on it(smile,red eye,motion stabilizer etc.)We took pictures of fireworks and a video of them and it turned out fantastic! It is very easy to use. Make sure you get a card,as the camera itself only holds 10 pictures. I would recommend this camera to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Blurry, unusable pics
Reviews.Author: D. Biggs
Reviews.Content: Before purchasing electronics, I usually research the product extensively.  My daughter needed a camera quick, so we purchased this camera and trusted the Nikon name.  My daughter (18 years old and taking photos her whole life) took about 250 photos.  I downloaded them to the computer and about 1/2 of them were blurry!  I thought it was "user error."  So many good pictures were unusable because of a focus isssue.  A multitude of excuses as to why she took such blurry pictures, so I took over.  I usually take pics with my Canon S5 IS (which I love).  I took a picture of a still subject while the camera was sitting on the table and it was still blurry!Bottom line- We returned the camera and will purchase something better.  I've read the other reviews and apparently this is not a problem in every L20.  It seems to be a quality control issue on the assembly line.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: King of Cards "Lucid S7V7N"
Reviews.Content: One step up from the Nikon L19. This camera sports a few nice features like macro mode, a 3.6X zoom and has a nice big display. Works GREAT with my SANDISK 4 Gig SDHC card. Nikon has been in business since 1917 and has given the photography world unparallelled quality and performance so I had no problems making this purchase and I'm glad I did!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L20
Reviews.Author: Joseph F. Mclaughlin "JoeMcL"
Reviews.Content: I waited until we took a two week vacation to the Northwest to rate this camera.  We bought it for a few reasons: 1) it was reasonably priced 2) it was rated as having a fairly fast response time (important for pix of our young grandchildren) and 3) the overall ratings were good.CONS-- It tend to confuse orange with yellow (as others have said) and it tends to overexpose some shots, especially "posed" shots of folks (not so bad for me in that you have a quick one-button fix to adjust exposure level, but my wife can't handle more than one or two buttons at a time!).-- It has a lot of options for various situations (a PRO), some that work for me, some that don't (a CON).  I took a few pans in hopes of using the included stitching software, but something went all wrong. I guess I should have practiced it first-- the facial recognition technology works sometimes, sometimes doesn't, not a big deal to me but a disappointment.-- a friend had an Olympus (in fairness, a lot more expensive than this) that had a much nicer LCD screen (about the same size, but more vivid/bright).  Had we not compared them, though, I'm not sure I would have noticed.PROS-- it is a pretty pearly red color!-- it is indeed quick to respond-- its size is just right.  We had a more expensive touch-screen camera, much smaller, that got trashed for that very reason- my wife had it in her coat pocket, it got caught in the car door and smashed.  So we didn't want too small a camera this time.  This fits in your pocket, but isn't small enough to forget.-- I like the AAs- buy Duracell Rechargeables, they last a LONG time-- the Auto/snapshot function works pretty well.  I tried a few shots with this setting versus the more specialized function (for isntance, the Portrait setting) and generally found little difference.  But some things are neat: for instance, the Food setting has a color-balance function that allows you to change the shading, which really makes it nicer.-- there is a quick macro-setting button, nice for us since we take lots of pix of flowers.In general the quality of pix was very good, given the price of the camera.  There is always a learning curve with these gadgets, and I am still learning- for instance, I still can't figure the difference between the Auto and Easy Auto Modes.  I highly recommend the camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon is better
Reviews.Author: J. Phillips "I do WOW"
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed in this product - my first digital camera was a Nikon Coolpix 2MP - great camera at the time - then I moved on to Canon after that. ALWAYS loved the Canon's picture quality and should have known better than to move away. I guess I got sucked into Ashton Kutchers ad's. Needless to say I was disappointed in the picture quality - a LOT of picture "noise" and JPEG artifects. Took it back and got a 9MP Canon Powershot and the image quality is night and day - a nit more expensive - but a GREAT camera!

Reviews.Title: "Teeny Bopper" Camera
Reviews.Author: Tyrisell "Breezy"
Reviews.Content: Bought this to temporarily replace my Canon until I could afford a higher grade camera and after using it for a few days I've decided to return it for a refund. I'm a hobbyist photographer and have plenty of experience with a multitude of cameras so an inexpensive point n' shoot such as this shouldn't have been a problem. I tend to steer clear of any electronic item that has a color other than standard silver/black as I feel they're typically marketed for the inexperienced and as teenager toys. In this case, I feel both applies. First, the PROS: I like the fact that you can use AA's rather than having a built-in rechargable, as you may not have the option to plug n' charge when you're out on vacation/sight-seeing. Sadly there is no auto-power-off feature so be sure to pay attention or even your spendy digital batteries are going to have a short lifespan when you need them most. The LCD is clear and large enough to get a good idea of what your photo will look like without having to squint. Camera has a sturdy feel/weight to it and is comfortable in a small to moderate sized hand. Ultimately the camera itself is fairly easy to operate and the fact that it has a built in video recorder will make it nice for someone who doesn't have need (or enough hands) to cart around a separate camcorder.Unfortunately, several of the images came out blurry, over-exposed (even with the exposure adjustments that are easy to set up), or the colors were 'off'. I noticed that the red-eye didn't go off when it should have - specifically for pet photos. Also, the shutter is so slow that if there is even the slightest movement from your subject the image blurs and will render the photo useless. I've also found that if the camera has any movement just after the shutter clicks (between 2-5 seconds after) it will also cause your image to blur...I'm not the most patient photographer when it comes to having to hold a camera still after pressing the button. I was also not impressed with the software for transferring images from camera to pc - I prefer a plug-n-play style of uploading images, not because I'm computer illiterate, but because I'm lazy and just want the darn thing to upload my files quickly so I can edit them and upload them to where I want to send them. For those of you who've had better success with this camera - you've either got much more patience than I, or just not as much experience with photography even within this price range of cameras. For a temporary camera that you don't have to fuss with, I'd recommend a kodak throw-away over this one. Otherwise, pay more for a higher quality Nikon or look at Canon cameras.

Reviews.Title: THE GREATEST COMPACT DIGITAL CAMERA
Reviews.Author: April kid "aprilkid"
Reviews.Content: I have taking pictures with film cameras for a long time with all well known cameras. I did close up of flowers, insects, landscapes, portraits, etc. I hesitate to change to digital due to high prices for my budget and have been reading all reviews and description of the most current models. In the meantime the film prices and developing services were going up. Many manufactures of photo film are not manufacturing film any more.Then my daughter came to visit us during her vacation and had this little mighty camera NIKON LC20. I asked her to take a picture for one of my vintage camera sat out at the front door. The results were superb. I could not believe the quality in detail, color and clarity.Amazon had it with a great price and I made my move and acquired one. I can tell you how happy I am with this little giant camera. With 10 Mega pixels and the wide and telephoto lens are great. The software is very friendly and was able to handle the problems that other buyer had, according to some reviews, blurred pictures is controlled when you hold the camera very firm. The quality clue, is to select the amount of pixels for each picture. I am using normal and the quality on all of them are great.The camera size is small, true, but you have to get use it, to how to handle. I will like to see a camera with a faster lens, perhaps 1:2.0 and more telephoto power, maybe 10X. Pixels are enough. This camera with those feaatures will make any other ones so obsolete. I consider to get another when that one is available.

Reviews.Title: Images are beginning to blur
Reviews.Author: YouReview
Reviews.Content: I've taken about 3000 pictures with this camera over several months.  Initially the pictures were very good, with only a few out of focus.  However, over time, more and more of the pictures are out of focus.  I am in the market for a new camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera. Don't listen to bad reviews. Blurry pictures are due to people not reading the guide or product being a lemon.
Reviews.Author: LadyLaura
Reviews.Content: The camera works great! I seriously believe that the bad reviews are from people who either unfortunately got a lemon, or who were too impatient to read the manual before playing around with the camera. The quick start guide is not enough...read the manual before posting a bad review.The guide is extensive, but very very informative and explains exactly which features are available with each setting...you can set many things manually if you want. However, setting the camera on normal Auto mode (not Easy Auto) takes great pictures. We even took pictures from a moving vehicle (we were on the freeway!) and the images were not blurry at all. To the people who have complained about the pictures having a yellow hue to them, they probably had the setting accidentally set to Macro.The videos come out great with good sound quality and image.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: R. Thompson
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, takes great pictures. Occasionally, the batteries fail to maintain contact with the battery door. It has to be opened and closed again to continue using the camera. At first I thought it was just draining the batteries quickly until I realized it was not making good contact.

Reviews.Title: Even an inexpensive camera should take a clear picture!!
Reviews.Author: Jodie B. Taylor "coastie wife"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera without any research, a friend had recommended Nikon, so we just trusted the brand and went for it.  We liked the price since we have three little ones who get their hands on things and tend to break them before they've run their life expectancy.  We knew we weren't getting a deluxe model, but assumed that we'd at least be able to take a decent, clear picture.  Nope.  Not on any setting.  And the time between shooting the picture and when the camera actually takes it is ridiculously long...its hard enough to get kids to look at the camera as it is...I can't tell you how many of our pics with this camera have been of my kids walking away from the shot (and to top it off, it's blurry!!).  Even the videos we've taken have been broken up and halted.  We'll probably go back to the Canon PowerShot!

Reviews.Title: It's a Giant Killer - Superb Pocket Camera!
Reviews.Author: Mark S. Deneen "juicymusic"
Reviews.Content: This is a superb little pocket camera that is all Nikon from start to finish - and the finish by the way is beautiful.I've had the camera a couple days and I just don't want to put it down! I have a NIKON D50 SLR for those really precious jobs, and I wanted a small camera I could have in the pocket sort of "all the time." I tried several small ultra-compact cameras and I hated them all. Too many weird buttons that made quick operation all but impossible without carrying around a telephone book sized manual. I mean, after all, what's the purpose of a pocket camera, if not to whip it out on a whim and get a quick picture?Here's three things I really like about this baby.1. There are four key buttons on the top deck: Power, Shooting mode, Review pictures and the shutter button. Pull the camera out, hit the power button and you can take a picture in a second. No fumbling, no hunting for the right button. It is logical, easy to remember and doesn't overwhelm you with a billion choices before you can take a picture.2. It takes AA batteries. Cool, I have boxes of AA and I don't need YET ANOTHER little charger! Plus, there won't be a bum lithium battery to try to replace in two years. AA batts are cheap and in this camera they last a long time.3. The LCD screen is HUGE, bright, and gives a great preview or slideshow.Here's the one thing I don't like: It's a bit fatter than my wife's 20mm Olympus. It's more like 1.1" thick. Not unmanageable, but it's as large as you'd really want for this kind of camera. It's the AA batteries that make it a bit thicker. BUT---shooting with this gem is 10X faster and easier than with my wife's compact Oly - (which is the most confusing menu system I've ever seen on any product in my life. )Oh, the pictures? So far I think they are fabulous. This is a 10MP camera - - how much do you need for a pocket camera? With a 4GB standard SD card you can get like 1000 pictures! That's a long party!Everything about this camera feels like a well made sports car - I may just pack up that big SLR and ......well, maybe not. But this will get plenty of use.

Reviews.Title: blurry pictures
Reviews.Author: K. A. Black
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this camera on the fly for my husband to take it on a business trip.  To check it out, I was playing with it a little bit and was unable to produce even one clear picture.  I thought it was me and tried different settings and more pictures.  I cannot make it work.  After checking here on Amazon, I see that this is a common problem with this camera.  It is going back to were I bought it, and I'll be looking for a different brand, something more reliable (this time after some extensive research).

Reviews.Title: Fuzzy Pictures
Reviews.Author: Robert C. Cook "Sundowner"
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this camera.  I thought the Nikon name would ensure a quality product.  I was wrong.  This Chinese made camera seems to have real quality control issues, especially around the area of picture focusing.  When I took pictures from one to eight foot distances, usually the pictures were superb.  However, my camera seems to have problems focusing at longer distances. If you read the reviews here, many people love the clarity of the pictures and a number of others find that the camera takes fuzzy pictures.  I think this is a quality control issue coming out of the factory.  Some of the cameras are manufactured properly, some are not.  I got one of the not manufactured properly cameras.  Some of the reviews here tell you how to take a good picture by doing this or that and that all the bad reviews are simply due to not reading the manual.  Not true.  If you get a bad one like I did, you can do any of the tricks mentioned but they won't fix a camera that has focusing issues.  Bad Nikon!

Reviews.Title: so so
Reviews.Author: E. Wright
Reviews.Content: the phot quality after transfer to my computer was not better in any way than our old 3.5 Megapixel canon powershot.tried all settings, retried with highest quality selections. just not better. and "sports mode was horrible. almost impossible to avoid blurring. a very disappointing camera for us. returned with no trouble at all.

Reviews.Title: Great basic camera
Reviews.Author: newby tech
Reviews.Content: Compact, easy to setup, very easy to use. The user interface is the best laid out camera interface I have used. Takes good pictures, a little heavy on green colors with outdoor shots in bright sunlight.Large LCD screen is great for reviewing shots but it is hard to see in bright light. Also, I would recommend a hard camera case to protect the LCD screen.The only con is the camera takes AA batteries instead  of a rechargeable battery. We average around 160 shots before we have to change batteries. your mileage will vary.ONE YEAR LATERAfter a year of use the battery door latch broke. This has happened to both cameras I have given out as gifts. I would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Loved it, Hate it ! DON'T BUMP IT. .
Reviews.Author: Stephine Adkins "Huntin Peck"
Reviews.Content: I am not a photo bug, but I know what I like in cameras. We actually own 3 assorted digital cameras, including my favorite, my Canon Rebel XT EOS. However, I wanted something for keeping on my body when out with my kids or to keep in my purse. The fact that the Nikon L20 took mini videos was a BIG bonus with me... I could leave my Blackberry in my pocket and get better little videos to email with the Nikon L20. And I could leave the Handycam in the house when not shooting major events. I found that I used the Nikon more outdoors than indoors since the shots were VERY slow indoors and photo quality dropped as natural light was replaced by our indoor light. I didn't care, it was a little camera for "casual" photos. Fast forward, first week of January 2010. I had the Nikon L20 in my hand, took a picture, left the camera on until it went to "sleep" waiting for my child to stop moving long enough for me to get a picture, pushed the button to take it out of "sleep" mode. The lens did not adjust and just took a really blurry/ fuzzy picture. I was puzzled and pushed the button again. The result was "LENS ERROR" in big red letters. Fast forward again, after getting the approval from Nikon to send the L20 back, the resounding and ridiculous email response amounted to they were NOT going to fix it and too bad. But I could pay them 106 dollars and change to fix it (more than what the camera is currently selling for). And no, they wouldn't send it back unless I paid them.  (I won't be having it fixed. I WORK FOR MY MONEY THANK YOU!) No longer is customer service part of what you are buying with a product. I didn't break it. However, from what I was told after the fact, it would NOT have taken more than a bump on the lens  or front of the camera without knowing to cause a multitude of "LENS ERRORS" on this camera. YEAH! Nikon got our money on this one, but never again. I am sure since SO MANY of these camera were sold "On Special" at various retailers during and after Christmas more and more reviews are going to show that this is a fatal flaw.

Reviews.Title: Raves
Reviews.Author: C. B.
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera. I like that I don't have to buy special batteries for it. I can use rechargeable AA's or, in a pinch find AA's anywhere. I don't have to worry about a special battery needing to be charged, or purchase more (expensive) special batteries for backup. This camera was delivered ahead of schedule and the price was nice. I've purchased three of these for myself and family over the past two years.

Reviews.Title: It was ok.
Reviews.Author: Just Me
Reviews.Content: My husband purchased this camera for me in the fall.  Unfortunately, it went through batteries faster than expected.  The first set only lasted through some fiddling the night I was given it, and about 30 mins. a few days later.  We replaced the batteries 3 times in just a couple of weeks and I am not a heavy picture taker.  I think it was because of the lack of a viewfinder.  The picture quality was much better than our old 3.1 megapixel camera, but the colors, etc. just felt average.  Ultimately, after replacing the batteries several times, we decided to swap it out for a canon powershot digital elph camera.  It was only then that I could truly see that the nikon had only an average picture quality.  I have only charged the cannon's battery twice in a month and a half - once when we first got it and then once more just in case because we were going to a party.  We have taken the cannon to the zoo, several school functions, my kids birthday party, and random other things.  The nikon, in comparison, did not make it 30 mins. at the state fair.  I took it out later the next day and was able to record video on those same "dead" batteries before the camera told me again they were dead. We also took it to a halloween carnival with mostly fresh batteries.  It lasted an hour of on and off picture taking.  This is just to give you an idea about the battery comparison and my camera use.  Finally, the one thing the nikon did very well, was extremely close up pictures.  There is a special setting that makes them clear.  You can even take closeups of fabric and small bugs.  That was nice.

Reviews.Title: not what i was looking for...
Reviews.Author: M. Brown
Reviews.Content: i bought this camera when my fuji started taking bad pics...i thought it was too slow in between pics so i wanted something new...this camera isn't even as good as my old one...need a point and shoot that isn't so slow but takes clear pics...i sent this one back and will pay more for a better one...

Reviews.Title: Great camera, very easy to use...
Reviews.Author: R. Wertz
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera mainly because of the 3" screen.  The first few pictures were not terribly imopressive but it turned out to be my fault (camera shake) and not the camera.  I've had the camera for more than a month and taken several hundred pictures.  They are sharp and clear.  If you have problems with your eyes, the screen is great because of it's size.  DO KEEP EXTRA BATTERIES HANDY THOUGH. I use recharables and take extras along.

Reviews.Title: PIECE OF JUNK
Reviews.Author: michael "frequentonlineshopper"
Reviews.Content: Look out folks, this camera will not last more than a few months.  Bought it and within a few uses, the camera lens jammed.  contacted Nikon customer service, sent camera back with receipt, and their response was, "we'll fix the camera for $100".  Seriously?????  They were unwilling to do anything for us.  Given that the camera can be bought for around that price, obviously we did not pay them $100 to fix a defective camera.We bought a Sony instead, and have been VERY satisfied.  Will NEVER buy Nikon again!!!

Reviews.Title: Great everyday camera/video recorder
Reviews.Author: West Loop Girl "miraven"
Reviews.Content: I needed a cheap camera for everyday, and this camera was the best.  It shoots great photos as well as little 1 minute video which I was able to upload on Facebook, etc.  Highly recommend it or its latest version.

Reviews.Title: OK for a beginner...
Reviews.Author: Maria Roglieri
Reviews.Content: This little camera I have been using for about a year, and is running relatively well.Pros:Portable, a little thick thoughEasy to use and figure outEffective Flash-WATCH OUT FOR RED EYE!Auto Focus OK for a range from 3 ft to 20 ftCons:Picture Quality not greatTERRIBLE battery lifeAuto Focus takes a long time to work---You can't take quick picturesBad close up shootingIn all, this camera is a perfect gift for an eight or nine or ten year old. Not great for much other than that.My recommendation is to buy a camera from Canon's ELPH line. These are smaller, thinner, easier to use, and in all better.

Reviews.Title: A great camera for most pocket applications.
Reviews.Author: Twistedwankel "Doug"
Reviews.Content: Got this camera on sale at Hhgregg for only $80.  The features and size exceeded requirements for what I was looking for to replace my old (fading yellow flash) Fugi 4mp 3X zoom for a quality pocket camera using AA batteries.  I have a 10X zoom kodak for vacation "great pictures and videos and long life battery" but it's too bulky to take on social occasions. And I don't own a camera cell phone.  Wasn't thrilled to see the L20 Coolpix was made in China but what isn't anymore?  The Nikon has a few "have to learn" features to finally get it right and isn't really intuitive for a 63 year old who is way behind on the electronic learning curve.  Once I learned that in "easy auto mode" one has to push the shutter button 1/2 way (like my old camera)to lock in the pix before taking it all was well.  Also once one plays with the multitude of advanced features and editing capability it becomes somewhat amazing using the enlarged screen.  It would be nice if there was a viewer but even in the bright FL sun I can still make out the objects I'm trying to photo.  I had one issue where I thought the batteries went dead without the logo warning and replaced them only to have it happen again so was ready to return L20 to store.  Upon closer inspection the battery/memory door is tricky (must use slight force down and sideways) to get closed properly and can otherwise be ajar making it lose power without any warning while off.  Once that problem was solved I have become very attached to this little gem.  The ruby red color grows on you too.  Like I said a little gem.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L20
Reviews.Author: Karolyn Quianthy "czechdoll"
Reviews.Content: We were looking to replace our old camera and I liked the features on this one and the price. It takes great photos and is so easy to carry with me. It is very easy to use and I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Disappointed
Reviews.Content: After so many great reviews, I find this camera so disappointing!  I don't have any special needs--just a camera I can grab at a moment's notice to catch fun moments in my children's lives.  Unfortunately, it never seems to focus on the subject well, either in the full auto mode or in special modes.  A lot of our pictures are taken indoors, so maybe it's an issue with lighting, but every other camera I've owned was able to function fine indoors.  So we will sadly be looking to replace this one soon...

Reviews.Title: Miserable Camera
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: I do not recommend this camera. I bought it and returned it right away. The "Easy Auto" mode is terrible. It is not easy, and it automatically suggests the wrong settings for the environment. The other individual modes are useless as well. Nearly every picture is blurry. The auto focus does not work properly, and the face finder is awful. The camera is also bigger than I think it needs to be, considering its dearth of features. Unless you like taking 5 blurry pictures of everything and picking out the one that is least blurry, do not purchase this camera.On the bright side, Amazon made the return process easy and convenient, and I promptly received a full refund. I definitely recommend purchasing from Amazon, just not this camera!

Reviews.Title: Buying 2 more...
Reviews.Author: Balaji
Reviews.Content: We use our digital SLR for photography but bought this camera for our parents. I used it for 2 weeks to take family photos. It is very nice. It can be set with full auto mode so elders do not worry about changing the settings, can easily take photos. The video is pretty good too. For this price, it is great!. I am going to buy 2 more, one for my in-laws and another one for us. We don't want to carry the big SLR to take photos of my son...this one will do it great!

Reviews.Title: My first digital camera
Reviews.Author: Sheepguy42 "Mac guy"
Reviews.Content: I've never owned a digital camera before, which is funny since I've helped many people figure out how to use theirs.My favorite thing about this camera is its Easy Auto Mode. When the flash is used, it takes impressive shots--even in my novice, shaky hands.My least favorite thing is its Easy Auto Mode. When the flash is not used, in a relatively low-light setting, I cannot hold the camera in my hands and take a non-fuzzy picture. The problem is that in Easy Auto Mode, the flash has 2 settings: Auto or Off. I'm not sure why the camera can't consistently figure out that we're in a low-light setting. I've used other semi-auto settings inside with some success, but my favorite shots are consistently the ones taken in Easy Auto Mode when it decides to use the flash. Why wouldn't they just have an "On" setting in there?Other than that, I love this camera. It's small--but not so small that I leave it where I shouldn't. It's solid--but not heavy. The large 3.5" screen is awesome, and there are no compatibility issues with my Mac so far. All in all, a great first camera.

Reviews.Title: What a HUGE disappointment!!!
Reviews.Author: Tina Marie
Reviews.Content: We took several pictures and they were incredibly blurry.  So, after having three people check the settings to make sure we had everything properly set, we were unbelievably disappointed, and knew we did NOT want this camera!I should have went with my first instinct and spent the extra to get a Sony Cybershot, and that's exactly what I did the day after Christmas!I have an older model 3.2 megapixel Canon Powershot, and it takes better pictures than this Nikon.  I would NOT recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Coolpix L20
Reviews.Author: Howard S. Weiss "hsweiss"
Reviews.Content: Great price and great camera.  Bought this for my daughter who didn't need (or want) a high end digital camera and this one fit the bill perfectly.  Personally, I like to have a "real" viewfinder and this camera doesn't have one.  But she doesn't care and she loves using the electronic finder.  Picture quality is very good.  Features are very good as well.  It also uses two AA batteries and so far, seems to be low power use with many pictures on the 1st set of AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: cool pix
Reviews.Author: Paul B. Cartwright "Master Gardener"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife, who is a point & shoot type. Works great! She can carry it in her purse easily, and she loves not looking through a tiny viewfinder to see the subject. The nice LCD screen is great to compose your shot. Yet, if you read the manual, and use the menus, you can also use different settings for your shots, like action, macro, portrait, etc. The only ( not so ) bad thing is the USB connection to the computer is NOT a standard USB connection, like the one for my bluetooth headset & my other cameras, so again, you need a separate cable. Don't forget you need to buy an SD card for it, the internal memory is soooo tiny. I got an 8GB card for it that works great.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for a bad photographer
Reviews.Author: Fred Saunders
Reviews.Content: The Coolpix L20 is a fine camera for a guy like me who's a casual photographer.  I get better pictures out of it than I ever did with other cameras because of the automatic features.  Couple that with the fact that I can take loads of pictures and erase the bad ones, I usually end up with some good shots.  That's what I wanted and that's what I got for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: good price for good camera
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Potter
Reviews.Content: Couldn't choose between the Coolpix or the Canon Powershot.  Both received good reviews, and both were in Consumer Reports Top 10.  I pretty satisfied with this camera overall.  I'm by no means a photography, but this point and shoot camera works perfect.  User friendly.  Picture quality if good.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth J. Kisling "loves great stuff"
Reviews.Content: I am not the best with photography, but this camera is an excellent purchase.  My cousin is a professional photographer and he saw my pictures on the camera, and said, "Wow, that little camera takes great pictures!"  I went to the STL zoo, and practiced using my camera, and it has great zoom.  The pictures came out looking like the animals were right next to me, not through glass, and caught their true "personalities".  And with the zoom, it can still focus.  I will recommend this camera to anyone!

Reviews.Title: not what I expected
Reviews.Author: Julie A
Reviews.Content: I did not do enough research on this item.  I have a Canon A75 that I want to give to my daughter.  I have a Nikon D60 DSLR as my primary camera, and I want an additional all-the-time camera. My criteria are simple. I just need a camera that will take acceptable pictures that I'm not embarrassed to share with my friends and family - I know not to expect the same quality that I get from my DSLR.  I was not at all happy with ability of the camera to reproduce colors - they were undersaturated and a little bit off on hue.  The LCD screen was completely grainy and made me dizzy. I took around 25 pictures and have packed it back up to send back.  I expected the low light photography to be less than GREAT, but I didn't expect it to be impossible. One thing I didn't realize when I bought this camera is that it really doesn't have ANY manual controls AT ALL - I guess I at least expected to be able to select my ISO, but it doesn't even have that.  You are at the mercy of the camera to select every parameter.  Every picture I took, inside or outside with proper lighting, had unacceptable noise.  My A75 blows this camera AWAY and I've had that 3.2 MP camera for almost 5 years.  I have even considered reversing my offer to my daughter and just 'sharing'. I've decided to go ahead and stick with the A series from Canon and have ordered the A1000 IS, so we'll see how that turns out.

Reviews.Title: Purchased two cameras - maybe got 100 pictures
Reviews.Author: Jodee D. Cairns
Reviews.Content: Purchased a Coolpix L20 for my daughter in September of 09. I am not a camera professional by any means but knew that Nikon was 'supposed' to be good. In a sideline story, another person who lives with me had the same camera purchased for her 5 months earlier.After my daughter had the camera for 2 months she came to me in tears because her screen was black with what appeared to be shattered glass. She had not dropped it or been rough with it in any way and was kept in a padded case. Then the other person, also afraid to mention it, said her camera had done the same thing after 3 months but her dad had not purchased the warranty so she did't say antying. Both of these young women have had cell phones and ipods that have lasted 2+ years. I had purchased the warranty for my daughters camera so I started pursuing that. I paid $129 for the camera, paid $24 to have it shipped correctly to Nikon only to be told the warranty did not cover the repairs. Nikon wanted $107 to repair the camera. I couldn't believe it. I asked to to have a supervisor call me and what I got was an email with pictures of the camera screen. That same week I saw the exact same camera, brand new, in a store for $79.00. I WILL NEVER EVER BUY NIKON AGAIN AND WILL ADVISE THE SAME TO OTHER PEOPLE. Nothing like having $350 'worth' of cameras that only lasted for 3 months. I want to add that buying a camera for me is not an spur of the moment purchase being a single mom with 4 kids and one income. Thank-you very much NIKON!

Reviews.Title: Can't make lemonade out of this lemon
Reviews.Author: Diana Elliott "DiE"
Reviews.Content: I own a Nikon DSLR and with that in mind I turned to the Nikon name again when choosing a point and shoot to carry in my purse.  I bought this several months ago for $109.00.  I really should have sent it back but thought-perhaps it was a learning curve.  Not the case---over half of the pics where blurry-just not a good quality camera.  Certainly, not what i would expect out of Nikon.  Recently bought a  Canon P&S; for my daughter and picturequality is way better.  I will buy Canon for my next P & S camera. Save yourself the time and trouble-avoid this particular camera.

Reviews.Title: A Convenient & efficient piece of equipment
Reviews.Author: Eileen Walker "OjaivalleyLaw"
Reviews.Content: My husband, a purblic works and construction inspector,  is not electronically or photographically efficient and needs to be able to take and reproduce good visual accompaniment for his written inspection reports.  He was having little success in the field with the camera he had and asked me to choose a new one for him.  After reading comparisons in various publications I chose this one as seeming to be the best quality with the size he needed for convenience walking large area projects.  He has had no problem operating the camera, the photos have been consistently clear and well focused (just using the default settings) and those needing to use these pictures for documentation have been highly satisfied.  Amazing results for a "little" easy shot camera.

Reviews.Title: Used Nikon's are great
Reviews.Author: dave k
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 Nikons in Japan when serving in the US Navy.  One was stolen (a knowledgeable thief) and the other banged around with me for the next 2 1/2 year in the service and for the next 40 years, including inside a plastic case to make it water proof:  we were in a submarine lying on the bottom off the coast of Coronado's Silver Strand where I trained for UDT special services. (I spent 2 weeks a year in the Navy Reserves, requesting UDT assignment. Any way, my supervising officer and the sub's captain thought it would be a good idea to "lock us out" with the camera (you get in a closet, close the door -water tight, and they flood it with water.  We had SCUBA gear on and when the space was flooded, we swam up and gave the signal (pounding the butt of a knife 3 times against the coning tower)  for the sub to come to the surface.  Took some good pics of my buddy holding onto the periscope.  I'm a Nikon enthusiast.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: RG Pensacola "rpg007"
Reviews.Content: At the end of the day, this camera ultimately takes very good pictures. The menu is a little bit of a pain to use and the screen on the back has poor resolution that makes judging the pictures on the spot difficult. However, once you figure out the best settings for your situation, the picture quality is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great camera...until the battery door broke!
Reviews.Author: Momof3Boys
Reviews.Content: This was my favorite of the digital cameras I have owned- super easy to operate, nice image quality, AA batteries, video in easy format to edit, big LCD.  I was going to buy my mother-in-law one for a gift because she liked mine.  I came to Amazon to order and saw a lot of people complaining about the battery door breaking. I decided against buying another just in case---well, a few months later, my battery door hinge broke, too.  I tried taping it, but it won't hold and the batteries keep springing out.  It's really too bad, too, because I thought the camera was great.  Maybe they have fixed it on the newer model?? Hope so.

Reviews.Title: Not well made
Reviews.Author: jnsnj
Reviews.Content: This item took good photo's and was easy to use, but the closure for the batteries broke with in a year of purchase.

Reviews.Title: It's not much.
Reviews.Author: C. K. Lyons
Reviews.Content: I wanted this for Christmas so my hubby got it for me. I am a photographer but I'm a snapshot junkie so I wanted a cheap, portable camera to throw in my purse, take to concerts, etc. I started in the photo biz before digital came out and then once it did, I began very familiar with which company is better for film, digital, etc. I should have never forsaken my love for Canon digital. Even the cheapest Canon is good. Nikon is the best for film cameras. This camera is a pain in the tush. It is very easy to operate but 1/2 photos come out blurry because it doesn't focus too well, not too great in low light, etc. When we go away, I give this to my 12 year old nephew to use and even he can't stand it. I thought I just got a bad camera but I have heard this from others. Get Canon folks!

Reviews.Title: WORST DIGITAL CAMERA I HAVE EVER OWNED
Reviews.Author: CODY E WINCHELL
Reviews.Content: Well my frustration with this camera came to a head last week on our trip to the Smoky Mountains....  I took 7 pictures of Bears and 6 of them turned out blurry.  We also went to the Nascar speed park and ALL of the pictures from there turned out blurry.  bottom line unless you are standing still this camera sucks completely.  i have tried every mode on this camera - auto/easy auto/running/portrait/landscape - you name it it simply isn't possible to take a picture of anything that is in motion.  A complete P.O.S.  also, anytime you ask someone "Hey, can you take our picture?" - you have to give them a lesson and tell them to "hold it EXTREMELY STILL - then push the buttom 1/2 way down - then the light will turn green - then push the button the rest of the way down" - it is effin impossible to teach someone how to use this p.o.s.  i am trying to return mine to Nikon for a full refund.  simply horrible - the worst digital camera i have ever owned BY A MILE!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: What's worse the camera or the company?
Reviews.Author: RX "WTF"
Reviews.Content: This camera operated properly for about two months. Then one day I started getting a battery error message. I couldn't do anything with the camera so I replaced the batteries with other new ones I had. The same problem, "battery exhausted" message would appear on the screen. The camera was completely unfunctional. I went and bought more batteries at the store, just to be sure it wasn't actually the batteries. The same error message.So now I have to go through the agravation to return the camera to Nikon Service Department. I packaged it up shipped it back to them and received my same camera back in about 2 weeks. I took it out the box, pushed the power button the camera immediately turned a solid color and the screen was locked. I couldn't power the camera off or on either. The only was to reboot it is to remove the batteries.I went the whole same scenario of trying different batteries and nothing worked. The screen would turn a solid color or I would get the same message, "battery exhausted" I just could get over the fact that the repair person, did not even bother to try to turn the camera on and see if it worked.I tried calling their customer no service number and of course I get someone who can barely speak english. I demanded to speak to a supervisor and they refuse to replace my camera with a new one. Maybe Nikon has good products and bad, but I'll never find out that is for sure. I would never buy anything from this company ever again.

Reviews.Title: Poor Camera, LCD conked off within days of using
Reviews.Author: turboguy "turboguy"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera online from Dell because of a nice deal. Sadly this camera's LCD failed within a couple of days of using it on a vacation. Just has white vertical lines and no menu comes up. Took about 300 photos and videos in those 2 days. Some were good, but some were darker even though lighting was not an issue and similar photos at same time came out ok. Also takes blur photos. Again in a sequence of photos some were ok and some blurred. All in all why do you want to waste your time if the photos you take (precious) do not come out okay. Better to get a reliable camera than a cheap one. Till now my Nikon opinion based on seeing the SLRs was top marks. Now not so.

Reviews.Title: It's a long shot...
Reviews.Author: Janet G. Tracy
Reviews.Content: if you get a picture that isn't burry.  This is undoubtedly the worst camera that I have used (not just owned) in my 30 years of enjoying photography.  I had an earlier HP point and shoot that was terrific.  Wanted an easily totable camera as opposed to the heavy gear of my slrs & lens.  As the saying goes, your best camera is the one you have with you. Not so with this one.  Maybe one in ten shots is passable and forget about indoors.  There is no accounting for when a pic is blurry or when the flash decides to work.  A friend also purchased this model and has the same opinion.  What can I say except, this is an un-Coolpix, keep on shopping and pass this one by.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: L. Robinson
Reviews.Content: I purchased a digital camera prior to this one and after returning it because of all the problems and difficulties of trying to figure out how to operate it, I returned the camera for a refund. Went on Amazon.com to research and shop for another digital camera and found this one. Most reviews were postive so I ordered it. I LOVE this camera! The ease of use was delightful. I'm not very "ditigal" wise, but never had a problem figuring this one out after only briefly reading basic instructions. I was concerned about using AA batteries because some cameras eat them up. The Nikon Coolpix will operate on these batteries for a long time. Went on two week vacation,took tons of pics and never had to change the batteries. Great product at a great price. Thanks Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for what it is - a cheap and small camera
Reviews.Author: Mike Henson
Reviews.Content: The best part is the large 3" display window. Along with a simple and easy-to-use menu, this camera was the perfect gift for my wife, who does not like to fuss with settings when taking pictures. Plus it's small enough to fit in her pocket or purse.Another great thing about this camera is its great battery life. We have taken over 250 pictures so far with it, including many with the flash, and are still using the original batteries that came with the camera!

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: C. Crite
Reviews.Content: I have had my camera for a year and I do love it. The picture quality is great. The price for this camera is awesome. The video is good, but not made to take video in loud places as in a concert, because it will be so distorted you can't make out anything. The features on the camera work great and are awesome. I wish the sound quality was a little better, I am looking to buy another camera that has good sound. This camera is good for normal picture taking.

Reviews.Title: Great if you are taking pictures of your stapler.
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Potucek "duramaterr"
Reviews.Content: This camera is not for those with children.  I have a 9 month old son, and pictures were 80 percent blurry.  Plus, the shutter is REALLY delayed, so forget catching 'at the moment' memories.  It went everywhere, and the construction is sturdy, but I can't afford to spend 80 bucks on a paperweight.

Reviews.Title: only good for posed pictures
Reviews.Author: Cory Wilson
Reviews.Content: If you want to take pictures of exact poses it is a good camera. If you like to take natural poses it is horrible. The Zoom is bad the flash takes way to long to recharge, and the face recognition and Auto settings are horrible.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix L20 is a great point & shoot
Reviews.Author: Kevin L. Swartz "cbtinker"
Reviews.Content: Haven't had any problems with the camera since I bought it.  It takes great pictures just like it should.  There are a couple things that could make it better though.  A little more powerful zoom and the ability to take rapid fire action shots would make this an amazing piece of equipment.  Of course I suppose then it would have to cost more.

Reviews.Title: Shout, Shoot and Carry On.
Reviews.Author: Lou C. Germain
Reviews.Content: a point and shoot camera right out of the box. Needed something quick for travel and vacation snapshots. Old camera broke and this was a reasonable replacement. Picture quality is good. Used some shots in close up mode for art painting reference- clear and nice detail. Upon unwrapping, I placed my own long lasting batteries and big SD card into camera. Sturdy strap -so I won't break this one. Since bulk and weight now count for travel, this could be a little thinner-- but I can always find it in my carry-on (taks a small case) Using flash in auto mode is easy and automatic for low light. I am left handed so the buttons always seem to be in the wrong place- but easy to adapt. Now to read the manual-- I'll find out all the things it can do!! I am shouting that the pictures came out with such clarity in bright sunlight!

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Erick R. Shockley "Erick"
Reviews.Content: This little camera is awesome!I would highly recommend this to anyone,pretty easy functions, it's not rocket science.

Reviews.Title: My review
Reviews.Author: Curtis Smith "Student"
Reviews.Content: My wife loves this camera I bought it for her as a Christmas gift and she is very impressed with the picture quality and the ease of operating the camera. My wife is not the easiest to please at times and she has no complaints about this camera, thank goodness.lol Amazon shipped the item right away I never had any problems with shipping or anything else an overall great experience. And another thing paid no taxes and shipping was free how can you beat that, way to go Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for my bf and he absolutely loves it. The picture quality is great and I love the wide screen on the back, it is very easy to use, we only had to look in the manual once (to see how to crop pics on the camera). It has great features. I would reccommend this camera to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Its a great little camera!
Reviews.Author: M. Wonders "LYN"
Reviews.Content: I am thrilled with this camera. A friend of mine had been looking a long time and when she bought this one she recommended it to me!

Reviews.Title: Great compact cheap camera
Reviews.Author: K. Lagula
Reviews.Content: very easy to use. picture quality is great as usual. nikon has always been a favorite when it comes to quality and features. color is beautiful. uses double A batteries which is OK. i just buy the good kinds. i love that it's 10 megapixel. never doubted nikon. very very cheap too!

Reviews.Title: Not a big fan.
Reviews.Author: Wendy Y. Alas "wendyalas"
Reviews.Content: I am a professional photographer and I bought this for myself last christmas thinking it'd be great to have for fun pictures/snapshots when I go out with my friends, or when I see something random that I like, not hoping to get the same qualities that I get from a professional DSLR, but at least something creative and hopefully a bit lomographic. I am however, quite disappointed and really don't like the quality of it. I wish I would have gotten a Canon powershot or a Sony Cybershot instead.

Reviews.Title: crappy camera
Reviews.Author: Emmett Robichaux
Reviews.Content: Some pictures were clear, others were not. Far too complicated, or the instructions were lacking in clarity. Returned for refund.

Reviews.Title: Nifty Nikon
Reviews.Author: B. Melendez "Real Text"
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the Nikon I purchased.  Have always wanted a Nikon, because I already knew they are one of the greatest picture takers.  This one had features a little different than one of the kodak easyshares that I've always had in the past, but once I figured it all out, it just as easy.  The only thing I would change would be the CD set-up.  After having the kodak, I am a fan of their uploading system that allows you to crop and change all the color settings etc.  That would be a plus if this one had one the same.

Reviews.Title: Great starter camera
Reviews.Author: Jorge Hurtado "Jorge"
Reviews.Content: I bought this a starter camera for my 7 year old.  It's better than any of the kid cameras that I found.  Battery life appears to be better than I expected with 2 AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Ronald Roberts
Reviews.Content: this camera is very good and easy to use if you are good at the extra settings you will have great pictures

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera.
Reviews.Author: Frank V. C. Volin
Reviews.Content: Great camera at a good price. Read and know the operating manual toget all the features from the camera

Reviews.Title: Good camera for under $100
Reviews.Author: S. Flynn
Reviews.Content: It doesn't have the most megapixels or every gadget/feature currently available, but it also is one of the least expensive cameras from a major name brand. It operates great and the 10 megapixel pictures are very good. If you want a camera under $100 that works great and don't need all the high end options, I would recomend this.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: Lesli "Lesli"
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix S230 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom and 3 inch Touch Panel LCD (Plum)Great Buy for teens... Not so small it will get easliy lost and not to bulky to take wherever they go...

Reviews.Title: coolest camera!
Reviews.Author: J. B. Fong "bookish butterfly"
Reviews.Content: Oh my Goodness, I love this camera! Some of my shots were shakey and out of focus and wow when I downloaded my pictures they became clear and in focus before my eyes!!! I love ,love love this camera!!!!

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Paul D. Mcmullen
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice camera, but it definately takes some time to getting used to. This is my very first camera though, so I wouldn't know how it compares to other digital cameras. I strongly suggest using the begginers manual. It tells you all you need to know about using the camera. The settings are a little confusing at first, but once you figure things out, it's very easy. The picture quality is very good, and the effects it has are very usefull. I would suggest this camera to everyone!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera--simple to use
Reviews.Author: Lisa Marie
Reviews.Content: This camera is very simple to use and a great design.  We have not had any problems with and the pictures turn out great.  Very well made.  Extremely happy with this purchase and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!
Reviews.Author: Katherine Schneider "AnnaSara"
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best camera's around.  It is so easy to use, takes great shots and uploads easily.  You can take it anywhere and it will take great shots in any weather.

Reviews.Title: Good Camara
Reviews.Author: Randal K. Getchius "Buyer"
Reviews.Content: Good camara, good quality.  Only drawback is that it is a little complex learning how to use the different options.  Pictures are excellent as is the video.

Reviews.Title: Nikon CoolPix Camera
Reviews.Author: B. Ahrenhlolz
Reviews.Content: We gave this to our daughter for Christmas.  She is thrilled with the picture quality and ease in use.  We own another  Nikon CoolPix and highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!!
Reviews.Author: Arthur J. Schuster "Cyndee"
Reviews.Content: 1st Digital camera I have had personally- have been looking at them for awhile, I am really happy with mine. It is so Cute! And the picture quality is fantastic! Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: C. Brinkers "Live to rock"
Reviews.Content: This camera is sold for a great price and is an excellent value. I paid about $40 more for my daughter's coolpix camera a year ago, and this one is 10 mp -- more than her 8 mp camera. It's easy to use and lightweight. It takes great pictures. I couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: J. Gregg
Reviews.Content: this camera is nice works good the only problem is the battery cover breaks very easy other then that its a good camera for older kids 15+

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: S. Girault
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter for Christmas. She took it out of the box, inserted the batteries and the memory card (that I purchased separately) and started taking pictures. Very easy to use! Within minutes she was trying all of the features which were easy to figure out. Well made camera, which is typical for Nikon. The deep red color is very "rich" looking.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Big C
Reviews.Content: This isn't a photographer's dream, but it's a fun little camera.I bought it for my wife on Christmas, because her older Kodak EZshare's screen was broken and was unusable. It was really nice that the memory card from her old camera worked in this new little gadget.It takes really crisp pictures, though it does take a bit to get used to the time. The thing we love about it most is that it turn on and is ready to shoot in about a second, which is really handy.The screen is quite large for the little camera as well, and that's a big plus. It's just beyond the size which I consider too small. The buttons are easy to press for both myself and my wife, and it doesn't feel like it will break very easily in our hands.I'd say for anyone on a budget, this is an excellent little camera to buy. You get an AMAZING deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: Takes pretty Cool Pics...
Reviews.Author: nathan hearns
Reviews.Content: So, Ive used a bunch of digital cameras in my life, but i had never really owned one. So, in preparation for my trip to Australia I decided to buy this Coolpix camera from Nikon. Now that my trip is over and after 700 pics taken in just over 3wks Down Under, I have to say the Nikon Coolpix is a pretty decent camera. Its one of the easiest cameras Ive ever used. Right out of the box, you pop in a digital media card for photo storage and then turn it on and you are ready to start shooting with the Auto Focus setting already enabled. This auto focus setting changes on the fly (which is good for beginning photo shooters) depending on the kind of shot your taking or time of day (sunlight or evening) your shooting photos. There are other focus modes available as well for more advanced photographers. There is also a video mode that allows you to shoot .avi videos. Has a great power saving function as well that turns off the camera after about 15 seconds of non-use as well. The one thing I dont really like about the camera is the slow turn on time. When you want to get a shot and need to take a quick photo, the Coolpix has a very slow turn on. It takes about 3 to 5 seconds before its ready for an actual picture. Otherwise, for the price I paid, Im very happy with the product...!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: A. Walter
Reviews.Content: Great camera for everyday use.  I keep it in my purse so I always have a camera handy just in case.  Great size and picture quality is great for the price.

Reviews.Title: acceptable
Reviews.Author: SC Local831
Reviews.Content: love the camera, the fact that its plastic made me a bit nervous because if i drop it it's over; not sure it was worth the $90 I payed for it. Overall though a very acceptable camera for quick photo taking!!

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera Ever!!!!
Reviews.Author: E. Canetta
Reviews.Content: We had a baby in February and bought this camera the month before she was due. I've missed so many moments because this camera is horrible. The flash goes on when it wants to and there is no rhyme or reason to when it cooperates. Then one day we had a lemonade stand for our 6 year old and the camera just didn't work...for 4 months! We were just about to send it back to the manufacturer and it decided to work again. We hadn't done anything differently and it was working but again, the flash is very inconsistent. This is a terrible product. With a name like Nikon, it should have been better.

Reviews.Title: Disappointment
Reviews.Author: beagle1lab2
Reviews.Content: Needed a small camera to carry in my pocket on a ski trip.  When this arrived, I took some pictures and immediately sent the camera back to Amazon.  The images were underexposed and blurry.  Ended up with a $130 Canon - I think it is unlikely you can get anything decent below $100.  This was my first and last Nikon.

Reviews.Title: dkhult
Reviews.Author: David Hult
Reviews.Content: The camera froze requiring removal of the batteries to restart.  We thought it was an isolated problem to our camera so we ordered another one, and the same thing happened so we bought a different camera.

Reviews.Title: I bought another as a gift.
Reviews.Author: John M. Majkrzak
