Reviews.Content: For such an inexpensive camera we are very happy with the quality of the photo's and the video's.  The panorama assist mode and panorama stitching software works great too.  Outdoor dusk/dawn photo's also come out nice with the photo's looking a little brighter than when you snap the shot. It is good on battery life unless you hook it to your computer to download the photo's.  I learned after the first time to just pop out the card and slip it into a USB card reader.

Reviews.Title: UNSATISFIED
Reviews.Author: Elvis Rivas
Reviews.Content: pictures are realllyy great.in other hand:- the lack of quality on the LCD screen is too bad!!- and other unacceptable and important thing for me is the flash's charging time... it takes about 7 sec to charge and you cannot take pictures between that lap.video quality is pretty good but:- sometimes when you are recording a video and you press the stop recording button then a message appear on the LCD screen saying that your video couldn't be recorded!!! SERIOUSLY, that really sucks!!! you lost your video!!!I've read other reviews before buying this camera and still bought it because of its high number of five stars reviews.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: L. Owens
Reviews.Content: I used this camera for the first time for my college graduation and it did not fail. I did not even know it had video on it. My husband was able to record me walking across the stage with this small camera and we took great pictures of the family as well. I would recommend this camera to anyone that has a small budget and it was worth every penny. GO SEMO!

Reviews.Title: Cool Nikon
Reviews.Author: L. H. Rauch "Doorshaker"
Reviews.Content: I haven't had a chance to use this camera very much as yet, but it appears to be well constructed and is great looking. One drawback I have found is the lack of a viewfinder when trying to take a picture.  When shooting out doors it can be very hard to see the screen.  Be aware of this when buying this product.  Otherwise,  a very nice display.

Reviews.Title: Was expecting more.. maybe I had to spend more...
Reviews.Author: E. Arguello
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera due to its 10 MP and since it was new (FEb 2009) But I think I got what I paid for, nice simple camera with some features but not all the hoopla I expected. Display is nice, my wife loved the color, but I think I got shorthanded with the quality of the pictures.Bought a transcend 8 GB card and it works fine (up to now)...

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this piece of garbage!!
Reviews.Author: RadMan "Rad17"
Reviews.Content: We bought one of these in July 2009 (brand new, from Amazon) to give to our granddaughter as a birthday gift.By September, less than two months later, the camera "froze" and nothing on it would operate. We sent it in to Nikon, who advised that the camera was "defective" -- they replaced it with another brand new unit. We received that unit in October.Thanksgiving (less than 6 weeks later): our granddaughter called to inform us that the camera's lens was stuck in the "out" position, and the camera would not turn off unless the batteries were removed. Once again, we shipped the camera to Nikon and asked (1) if they had experienced a bad production run of these cameras, and (2) could they fix or replace it?Remember, *this camera was always carefully handled! No abuse, didn't accidentally get dropped, etc.*Nikon's response came today: They'll fix it, for $87.00, and provide NO warranty on the repaired product.We paid over $100.00 for this camera at the beginning of July 2009. That's less than 6 months ago, and we've already been through two of these things and now have NOTHING.VERY POOR QUALITY ON THIS CAMERA.  PURCHASE IT AT YOUR OWN RISK!!I'm telling Nikon to trash the thing (they can keep their garbage!), and I'll buy something else -- ANOTHER BRAND -- for my granddaughter.Needless to say, I'm very disappointed that Nikon fails to stand behind their products (but understandable, if they're having this kind of failure rate), and disappointed at Amazon for letting Nikon sell this garbage, leaving their customers to end up with this junk.If you buy one, don't say you weren't warned.....!!!

Reviews.Title: We tried this out in the store and it seemed great!
Reviews.Author: Debra Baughman
Reviews.Content: We had decided to buy a new camera as our Christmas gift to each other this year. When we were looking we tried out all of the cameras in our price range. Cameras get updated so quickly, that we tend to get a new one every 2 or 3 years, so don't like to spend a lot. We were looking for a few qualities, mainly at least 10 megapixel,large LCD screen and at least a 3X optical zoom. This camera met all of the qualification. We were upgrading from a 5 megapixel with poor zoom because when cropping, many pictures were very grainy. Our sons wedding was coming up and we knew we would be taking some pictures from a distance and would like to have a better camera. I practiced taking some pictures before the wedding and could not get one picture that was not blurry! I was only taking pictures of things around the house, so there was no movement. I had my husband take some also and he had the same problem. Also I tried every scene on the camera and the colors were not good at all. We still took the camera to the wedding, but ended up using the camera on our phone. Those pictures were much clearer. Needless to say, this camera will be going back today.

Reviews.Title: The best camera of all
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Askey
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera of all. Unless you work for National Geographic and are taking photos of a crocodile's eyeball, or some other really specialized use, get this camera. The Nikon inventors can quit now - this is the best one there is.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Blows Olympus Away
Reviews.Author: Anjou
Reviews.Content: This camera is so good that we bought 2 of them. This is my 3rd Nikon camera. My wife found this camera on sale at W; later on I found an Olympus X-21 with 12MP which is suppose to be a better camera.For starters, the Nikon L20 is more intelligent than the Olympus X-21. The L20 has a lot more functions for different settings. The Olympus takes excellent snapshots with perfect conditions and lighting (so does the Nikon) however, the real test came tonight at Sunset; when the lighting conditions are not as friedly, I took several shots of the same subject with flash at 8 feet away when it was not dark yet; the Olympus X-21 did not take a single well exposed shot. The Nikon did it very well at 6, 8 and 10 feet away on the first take.X-21 takes xD card vs. L20 uses SD and both are capable of the microSD.Both came with a pair of Alkaline AA batteries, and with Nikon you can also get the "*2 - FR6 / L91 (AA-size) lithium batteries" from Nikon.You can get both cameras for under hundred bucks; so both cameras are really good for the price, but the Nikon I think blows away Olympus at least between this 2 camera models.Happy Shooting! =o)

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L20
Reviews.Author: Harlon Pickett
Reviews.Content: I'm certainly not a high tech camera person but this camera has done all we've expected.  The photos are just fine and the software works just fine for downloading etc.  I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Camera is good, but vendor selling it is not
Reviews.Author: gfernok
Reviews.Content: The Coolpix takes good pictures for the price range. Easy to use. Not as good as higher end cameras. The vendor "17th Street Photo" was just terrible! Zero stars! Bought it from them directly, what a mistake. Never again! They called me to confirm the order, and told me that it was on the way, that I'd have it in a week or so. Never came. I called them four separate times. Always said that it was on its way. Lies! Nothing but lies. Don't trust them at all! Just horrible customer service! Wasted hours on the phone with them. Buy from Amazon next time! Absolutely NO SATISFACTION from "17th Street Photo" in 34 west 17th street, 3rd Floor, New York, NY 10011, Tel: 1-800-664-1971. They now sell on Amazon too. Would not trust them at all!

Reviews.Title: Pretty good for it's price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I do not know what the others are smoking or if they need glasses but the pictures are NOT blurred as what they are stating.  After you take a picture, the display looks blurred at first but after a second or two after the picture completely loads it reveals the sharp & final picture.  The problem with the others is that they complain at first sign of trouble without checking it out first.  It's a good camera & worth the price.

Reviews.Title: L20 coolpix
Reviews.Author: Adrian Giannini
Reviews.Content: this camera is a perfect camera, no Batteries to recharge unless you want rechargable AA or you can purchase the 40 pack  at costco for $10. then never look for a wall plug. I like all my porables to be AA and the features are great. you cant miss with this one

Reviews.Title: broken
Reviews.Author: George
Reviews.Content: The door that holds the batteries in place was broken upon arrival.  This is a common problem for these cameras.  It should not have been sent out that way

Reviews.Title: Love it but...
Reviews.Author: kisetta
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera but honestly I hate the time delay and the sheer number of settings.  There are too many settings so its hard to figure out which one you need to use and the favorite setting where its supposed to pick one doesn't really work.  For the price its sort of what i expected but you'd be amazed how many things you miss in the 2 - 3 seconds it takes to take the picture - especially when you are trying to capture toddler moments.  Kind of frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Digital camera bread
Reviews.Author: cynthia CASTANEDA
Reviews.Content: It stopped working on me after a month or so from now I just have here sitting on my just paid money for what you don't want no more

Reviews.Title: A disappointing product
Reviews.Author: TW Choate
Reviews.Content: For a Nikon product, this camera mediocre functionality and usability disappoints. It seems like it was rushed into the under $150 market without much concern for quality.

Reviews.Title: Okay, but not rugged
Reviews.Author: Gerald H. Peterson "Jerry NJ"
Reviews.Content: Don't know why Amazon reminded me to review- I think we've had this camera for 10 years, must have purchased from Amazon.  The camera is okay if the person carrying has a "modicum" of technical interest and knowledge about photography.  Too much for someone, my wife, who really wants a "just" point-and-shoot.  Now that isn't really a back mark on the camera, but given the above is the life it led, and was in general not used, the battery compartment cover failed.  It looks to be a DiY job as the parts are available on eBay (I think) and how to fix is on Youtuve.  I haven't tried to repair for the above lack of use reason.Simple advice:  Don't buy any camera with lots of capabilities that only confuse the user.

Reviews.Title: coolpix
Reviews.Author: tony c
Reviews.Content: The camera came on time, but it was slightly damaged, (the locking device was bent, compartment was taped shut). All in all though I am happy, Iwas able to repair damage in no time at all.

Reviews.Title: P. Bowen
Reviews.Author: Paula B.
Reviews.Content: I had a Nikon Coolpix L20 camera which was ruined on a scuba dive trip.  This was the last dive on the trip.  Somehow  the o-ring in the underwater housing for this camera was pinched and the camera got flooded.  When I came home I tested the underwater housing and it appears to work fine and no water got in the unit.  That is when I knew that somehow the o-ring must of been pinched a little to let water in the housing.  This dive operator was supposed to have a tank of water to do a camera check so you would know if their is any problems.  This dive operator did not have one on the mother ship.  This dive operator was a live abourd which is the Aggressor fleet.  Most of the Aggressor fleet have a tank on the mother ship for camera checks to see if their is any problems.  So divers get a slight flood not a full flooded camera.  I complained to the staff on the ship since they always ask for improvements  on their ship.  This is the Aggressor ship in the Maldives.  I contacted camera repair places and found out that fixing the camera is just as expensive then buying a new one.  I have to have a Nikon coolpix L19 or L20 that is the only camera that will fit my underwater housing.  The Nikon coolpix cameras that are available right now in this line is L26 and this one is a L20.  I can  not see spending for a new underwater housing unit since  I already have one that works just fine.  I bought the camera from the seller on Amazon which the seller shipped the camera really fast.  When I placed my order of  the camera on Thursday it was shipped one hour after placing the order and I got the shipment on Saturday.

Reviews.Title: It's okay
Reviews.Author: Judski
Reviews.Content: This camera takes decent pictures but it wears the batteries out too soon.  I was using rechargeable batteries but they didn't last long at all.  I have started using single use batteries and they seem to last a bit longer.  I wouldn't recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: An easy camera to use
Reviews.Author: Gary Bates Bell
Reviews.Content: All aspects of this camera were quite satisfactory, except battery life.  I don't use the camera any more than once a month and it seems that almost each time I have to replace the two AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: D. Legendre
Reviews.Content: I ordered for my daughter..it takes wonderful pictures and is lightweigh also easily fits into pockets...would order again..received quickly..thank you

Reviews.Title: Takes good Pictures.
Reviews.Author: Robin Nixon
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a while ago and even though i don't really use it anymore because my smartphone has a camera it took really good pictures when i did use. i will use it again in the future and i love the color.

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: John W. Fortman
Reviews.Content: this camera is easy to use ,i have very little experiance with cameras i like the pictures and how easy it is to load in my computer, it was shipped fast and very good price

Reviews.Title: nice camera, but now outdated.
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for Christmas a couple of years ago to replace my Kodak easyshare c813 I gave to a friend. I took quite a few pictures with it, and it has great quality...with the flash. Outdoors quality is fine but indoors, I don't care what kind of lighting you have, the quality sucks without a flash, which doesn't make it very good for mirror portraits. And I was very pleased with shipping. I had amazon prime at the time, and I got the product the very next day after I ordered it. But though I had fun with the camera, I passed it on to my grandma who isn't very tech savvy on cameras, and this one should be easier for her to use than her old vivitar. Plus I have an HTC vivid, and it takes pics just as well, and I don't have to carry my camera everywhere with me, because I have an 8mp phone camera. Lol

Reviews.Title: Good when it worked
Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: This camera is new and we only used it on one trip.  Initially it was great and had a lot of cool features that my kids liked such as the multi shot feature.  So we took it on a trip...never dropped it and one day I handed it to my son he went to take a picture and the screen turned black then purple.  It stayed purple for the remaineder of the day.  Then it worked the next morning.  After taking two pictures it went dead like we need to change the batteries.  but NO....batteries are fine the camera is dead!  Normally I like Nikon but not this time!!!!  I am hoping this is a bad one from a bad batch and that this isn't the "NORM".

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Tamara Crowe
Reviews.Content: I Love This Takes Wonderful Pictures I Am Very Pleased With This Camera Would Highly Recommended This Camera To Others!

Reviews.Title: Worst Camera Ever!
Reviews.Author: Shauna L. Puckett
Reviews.Content: I would give this camera 0 stars if I could! Out of the many cameras I have owned and used in my lifetime this has to be the WORST. Image quality is horrible and grainy. Color clarity couldn't be worse in low light situations. The LCD screen isn't great for viewing true images. I can't take a photo at sunset or in low light because they turn out grainy and gray-toned no matter what setting I use. After the first use I would have returned it but this was my replacement for a malfunctioning camera and I would have had to pay a restocking fee!

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Gabe "Gill"
Reviews.Content: Great product! It's basic and does what its suppose to do. You get what you pay for on this one. It is a little sensitive on camera movement while taking pictures. If you move just a little bit, it will blur the picture.

Reviews.Title: Bought this camera almost two years ago
Reviews.Author: Em
Reviews.Content: And it still works great. It takes good pictures and video. The only complaint is there is sometimes too much of a delay while it tries to focus and get a good picture. Otherwise, very durable and easy to carry along on all our outings.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing reliability
Reviews.Author: Erik Gordon Bainbridge "Author, virtual world...
Reviews.Content: I've been a fairly hard core Nikon enthusiast for years, having owned three Nikon SLR 35mm cameras and two Nikon DSLR digital cameras.  I've always been totally satisfied with Nikon reliability, so when I needed to buy a point-and-shoot for taking pictures inconspicuously at conference break-out sessions, buying a Coolpix was a no-brainer... or so I thought.I was wrong.To my later chagrin, I convinced a friend to buy an L20 at the same time I bought mine.The picture quality was OK.  Not as good as my Nikon DSLR's, but that's not surprising.  The pictures were decent, the camera was small, and its operation was quiet, which is what I needed.  My only complaint was that the SD card is in the same compartment as the batteries, but that's a small complaint, and I loved having the convenience of AA batteries.All was fine until one day, just a few weeks after the warranty expired (of course!), the LCD screen suddenly looked like a Rohrshach test.  At about the same time, my friend contacted me and asked about the strange pattern on his L20.  The very same thing had happened to his!  A web search revealed that this is a common problem with the L20.  Nikon says it's due to improper care, but both these cameras had been carefully handled.Nikon wanted nearly the price of a new L20 to repair it, so that was out of the question.  I found that there are people on the web who will repair it for a lot less, or sell you the parts to repair it yourself.  I bought the parts and replaced the LCD screen myself.  It wasn't hard.  It just took some careful handling.  The main problem you're likely to encounter if you do it is that if you don't screw the case back together with absolute care, the zoom stops working.  It's easy to fix.  Just take the camera back a apart and reassemble it.  My friend did the same thing with his and it worked also.Everything was fine for a few months until suddenly one day, once again, no picture on the LCD screen, but this time the problem wasn't the LCD.  It's probably something internal.  This time I'm giving up.  I may buy a Panasonic Lumix as a replacement.  I choose the L20 over a Lumix the last time because of the quality I used to associate with Nikons, but the L20 has been a huge disappointment.Sadly, this Nikon enthusiast cannot recommend the Coolpix L20.UPDATE: My friend ordered a Panasonic Lumix to replace his broken Coolpix and was going to throw out the Coolpix.  I saved it from the trash, dismantled both his Coolpix and mine, and transplanted the LCD from his camera to mine.  Mine is now working perfectly.  It's a really nice little camera, but based on my own experience and the experience of so many others, I know it's probably only a matter of time before this LCD dies also.  In the meantime, at least I have a working point-and-shoot.  I don't recommend that people take this camera apart if they aren't experienced in taking apart electronics - I've been doing it since I was a kid.  However, if you are handy at this sort of thing, it's actually pretty easy.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix Camera
Reviews.Author: Deborah Williams
Reviews.Content: I am an insurance adjuster and really hard on cameras.I have had good success with the l20,l22,and l24 coolpix cameras. I use these cameras because of the quality,ease of use,and they are fairly inexpensive. If one quits working,it gets tossed.In my line of work, these camera get a lot of abuse and probably would last forever under normal conditions. They are not impact resistant however and do not withstand being dropped on concrete floors,driveways,sidewalks, etc,but I do not expect that from any camera. I would recomend this camera to anyone wanting a dependable,inexpensive camera.

Reviews.Title: Just don't last
Reviews.Author: Denise
Reviews.Content: This is the second Nikon Coolpix camera that I purchased within 3 years.  A camera should operate longer than 14 months, especially when they are not being constantly used or used by different people.  The L20 was used on 3 trips and the screen stopped working.  Since I had the camera for 14 months it was out of warranty.  I called Nikon and they suggested that I send it in for an estimate, Nikon quoted $110 to repair the camera.  Why get it repaired when I can purchase another camera for the same price.  I will never buy another Nikon Coolpix camera.

Reviews.Title: not a bad camera, but...
Reviews.Author: Norine M. Desilva
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera almost 2 years ago.  I have taken over 2700 shots.  A lot of them are great quality, maybe I got lucky with the lighting or the subject.  But now I want to get serious about my photos.  Forget about taking macro shots, and trying to take a picture of something or someone that is not the least bit still.  I was going to try and ride this camera out, there are so many different cameras to choose from, (digital, SLR), without mentioning the price you are going to pay for the one that fits you. But I will be finding a new and better camera as this COOLPIX L20 is cracked where the door to the battery compartment latches onto.  Bottom line, not a bad camera, but if you can afford to buy up, do some homework and find a camera that suits you, and one that will last more than 2 years.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L20 10 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: August W. Mueller
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife.  She loves it!!  Easy to use - excellent photos -- just what she needed.  I USE IT TOO!

Reviews.Title: This Camera Suffers From An Old Problem
Reviews.Author: Geezer "leinieman"
Reviews.Content: I wish I would have Googled "Nikon CoolPix Recall" before I purchased this camera. Evidently there are recalls for Coolpix camera models that involve defective battery compartments. This particular model is not on the recall list but it should be. I was able to take about 3 pictures before the camera overheated and quit working. The case became very warm, not quite smoking. I checked the battery orientation and it was correct per the diagram inside the battery compartment and the owners manual. The baterries were also very hot. I was not able to get the camera to work again after this. It was toast. This camera is on the low end of Nikon's Coolpix camera line and probably should be abandoned. It is too cheaply manufactured to withstand any punishment and will only cause public relations problems for the company. Stick with what Nikon does best... better cameras in the mid to higher level markets. I have a Coolpix S620 that is a wonderful camera and I have now ordered another before they disappear. I will use these cameras where I don't want to tote my Nikon D80 or I need an AVI file. What a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: No good for sports moments/any event!
Reviews.Author: Oh Well
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't suggest this for sports moments at all! Even on Sports mode all my pics came out blurry, I thought the purpose of the sports option was for capturing movement.. Well, not with this one, not mine anyway and I purchsed mine brand new, not used.If you do purchase it, buy a big SD card so you can keep it on the 10MP setting at all time for basic picture taking. No matter what I did I ended up back on default setting, starting over and over and over, it's been awful. I purchased it to capture my children's extra curriculars. Even just sitting in the bleachers at a track meet the zoom was crap. They looked like blurry ants at the highest zoom, just being still more of a crisper ant but still an ant.Even trying to get a picture at the skating rink up close, I had to only do stills..As far as my experience, I consider myself an intermediate user. After I bought mine, this one, I went to the pawnshop and bought my daughter a Kodak(5 maybe 8MPs) because of their misuse and the Kodak took WAY better pictures! I was very sad. I took both to a game at Cowboy stadium and the Kodak got up close and personal to players on the field, oh, but not the Nikon! I even had one of those 4mp camedian(something like that) one of those from like 5 years ago when it was 2.1MPand it was better. I've had a few digital cameras in my time and out of all of them, this is the worst. I am so disappointed. When I saw it and saw Nikon and the beautiful color and the $100 sale price along with the microphone fearture I was all in. After my lack of track meet moments caught with this camera I'm about to browse a while on here, then craigs then out to the pawnshops tomorrow. Maybe I'll give this one to my 5 year old.For those who may ask why didn't I use the Kodak if it's so much better, well the screen was smashed.

Reviews.Title: Tiny Lifespan!
Reviews.Author: Darasia Selby "Omo Oshun"
Reviews.Content: I used this camera about 4 times before it stopped working!  It wasn't the easiest camera to maneuver either.  Definitely not recommended.

Reviews.Title: Best of the Budget Cameras
Reviews.Author: Nick Tropiano
Reviews.Content: Professional reviews of this camera commend its sharp distortion-free lens quality and the camera's color accuracy.  I bought this camera modified by a 3rd-party to take only infrared photos, so I can't comment on color accuracy.  (But the infrared pics my modified Coolpix L20 takes are phenomenal.) In use the camera starts quickly and there is virtually no shutter lag.  The camera feels extremely solid in hand - I was very surprised by this compared to how fragile other budget models I've owned in the past by other manufacturers seem.  Its solid weight and build quality exceeded my expectations. This is a point-n-shoot so it's not going to be feature rich but everything you need is there and more.  The menu system is very well-designed and intuitive.  I didn't read the manual and figured it out in a minute.  Another thing I think is great is that Nikon included a manual white balance mode, which can't be taken for granted in budget models.  This improves picture quality enormously when used especially in mixed lighting.  Preset white balance modes nearly always result in an ugly color cast in tricky lighting, and this feature is simply "a must" for shooting infrared. 10 megapixels is more than enough resolution for larger prints.  The large bright 3 inch monitor is also a surprising nicety in a camera at this price. It's a very sharp looking camera in glossy red with silver accents.  What sets this camera apart is its very sturdy build quality, above average optics,  inclusion of a manual white balance feature, its big LCD size, and its handsome looks. The only downside is images get noisy above ISO 400, a common issue with all digicams. Overall a very well-done camera by Nikon in the budget segment. The Nikon Coolpix L20 is a great value.

Reviews.Title: Not bad, Price is right.
Reviews.Author: Brett
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for work, simple shots nothing too artistic. Wish I would have known it takes AA batteries, probably would have chose something different if I would have known. It takes nice pictures but not in the cold. Had trouble with shutter speed outside in snowstorm, but works well in all other situations. Great price too.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: Mightyphotogal
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this point and shoot camera to anyone wanting a simple camera that is easy to use. It take great pictures.

Reviews.Title: One to work with.
Reviews.Author: Myia A Carreiro
Reviews.Content: Let me put this in easy context so that you may know what to like and dislike about this camera:Pros:  With the right setting, the camera may take beautiful pics (with the right photographer to:) Black and white pictures end up nice...is a good beginner cameraCons:  Most pics end up blurry in color. Also, the color is a weird tint, and is almost always fuzzy and foggy looking. My lense is clean, and I have explored all the settings. You could say that I know this camera very well :) Also, my camera stalled out quite a few times. To the point that I can't just turn it off again, but I have to open and close the battery door to turn it off, and then turn it on again. It does this quite a few times. This a huge problem when trying to take spur of the moment pics, and pics of temporary things like perhaps a butterfly, or bird.I would recommend this camera only for the purpose of a short term use, for the use of someone on vacation to a resort or something of that sort, where the tropical lighting is perfect. However, in any lighting that is not just perfect, this camera takes very fuzzy pictures with little integrity as far as the color goes. With a price at $89 this is just the camera.I am going to purchase another higher quality camera to accomidate my photography needs. So if you are aspiring to take user friendly, quick, and easy pics...I would not reccomend this camera :)

Reviews.Title: LCD Screen & Controls Already Inop!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: The only viewfinder is the LCD screen that I could hardly see standing outside on a sunny day, anyway. But that broke in about a month, along with any way to change any of the camera's settings, though I have no recollection of treating the camera roughly or subjecting it to any unusual conditions. Actually, I am making a game of snapping pictures with it, as is, taking "point and shoot" literally, letting the universe frame shots. Because the LCD interface broke on high-rez, I can usually crop the results down into one or more OK pics, heh, heh.

Reviews.Title: Cheap and broke within 30 days
Reviews.Author: Tracy Carver
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter who is 13. We were at a family function and she was using it when the lens decided it wouldn't retract and the camera stopped working. I was sitting there with her so I know it wasn't dropped or hit. We tried everything and the lens never worked again. I do not recommend this camera for anyone who plans on using it!

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: James William "DrLove"
Reviews.Content: this is a good camer. it uses two aa batteries with auto focus. it's missing the count down option. the count down option is 10 secs there should more options for the count down option. other than that. it's a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Fine Camera
Reviews.Author: Cathy
Reviews.Content: Bought for 9 yr old. Camera is fine. Takes photos and movies. Great purchase.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY!!
Reviews.Author: got taken
Reviews.Content: This camera will easily break.  Nikon will not honor their warranty even if it is within their warranty period.  Read my experience, and you'll see.I bought this camera in December 2009... rarely used it, and stored it in a shockproof case.  By July 2010 it was broken.My experience with Nikon's service was worse than the lousy camera.  They sent me a photo of the camera to say that I broke it, and that it's not under warranty.  All I have asked for was to have my camera fixed... I have asked for service, not an estimate!  Also, the estimate was a scam.  In the estimate, they asked me to pay more money to repair the camera than what I paid for the camera in the first place!  I was already out some cash since I spent money just to send it back safely to them.  It was truly pathetic.I was truly appalled by the response that I've received.  I merely wanted my camera fixed - for Nikon to honor its warranty for a broken camera.  For a company to stand behind its product.  This was NOT what I got.I have tried to keep an open mind.  However, based on Nikon's pathetic response, and the lousy lack-of-service I've experienced, please make no mistake - I highly doubt that I will buy a Nikon camera again.  In fact, I plan to go out of my way to share my negative experience to everyone in my influence as I vent my severe discontent at Nikon.Scammed - that's how I truly feel.  They should not sell any more of their lousy products - they really should be on the public's DO NOT BUY list.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Roberto
Reviews.Content: This camera sucks! The screen died after 10 months.  It requires surgeon's hands for the image to come out ok.  My daughter hates it. It takes good video but now the screen is dead, so who cares.  Go for Canon S20 and above instead.

Reviews.Title: Mode options makes this a great little camera
Reviews.Author: Gigie
Reviews.Content: Gave this camera to my sister and she loves it. It's easy to use and the snapshots are good quality. Not a dslr but a good snapshot camera with video capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix L20, defective battery door
Reviews.Author: L. Brecht "Rainy"
Reviews.Content: My camera freezes often & I get 'battery exhausted' even with fully charged rechargeable batteries.  If you google the issue turns out it is likely the battery door with sensitive or defective contact points to the batteries?  If you open & close the door, the problem goes away, for a while. This is my 4th Coolpix camera & I am not happy about this at all.  I will check a camera shop to see how costly/successful the repair might be ;o(

Reviews.Title: Deal camera for the price tag
Reviews.Author: S. Malyala "SiouxBuyer"
Reviews.Content: It's a good point and shoot for beginners. Nothing more to expect for that price. I recommend this camera for all beginners who wants cheap and good camera.

Reviews.Title: Slow on the uptake
Reviews.Author: Mongoose "Dealsearcher"
Reviews.Content: Aside from weak zoom options the problem I have with this camera is how long it takes the camera to take the picture. It doesnt work well for taking pics of squirmy kids. The picture quality is fine and the functionality works pretty well. But when the scene is right the camera is not ready in a click.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality
Reviews.Author: C. McCullough "cm"
Reviews.Content: Took good pictures, but froze up a lot - had to remove and replace batteries to reset.  Finally, LCD stopped working altogether.  NIKON refused to warranty stating "this is not a manufacturing defect."  Nikon makes great stuff, just don't expect them to fix it if it doesn't work!

Reviews.Title: save your money and buy something else.
Reviews.Author: Darrell Crowe
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a Christams present after my old one broke.  My old camera broke probably due to age it was an old Canon Powershot A460.  I'd never had a Nikon but had heard good things about it so I was very excited to get the new camera.  I was very dissapointed.  My 3 year old canon took much better pictures than this camera.  I don't have very many good things to say about this camera, but here goes.  It had a large screen, the camera was easy to use, and it had many features.  The cons were much more abundant.  It took forever to take pictures, the pictures were not clear, i had to change the batteries 3 times in the course of taking 180 pictures, it told me the batteries were dead when really they werent, and none of the pictures i took on zoom turned out at all. Do not buy this camera it has only caused me frustration.  Two of my friends also got nikon coolpix cameras for christmas and have also had problems. Stay away from nikon, if i had money to buy a new camera i would.

Reviews.Title: I regret purchasing this camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Greg S"
Reviews.Content: We have a D-SLR camera and my wife wanted a compact camera to keep in her purse for those spontaneous moments.  This camera on paper was perfect: large screen, great brand, huge resolution.  I also liked the AA battery feature b/c the battery on our old compact digicam always seemed to be dead when needed most.  The picture can take a great picture...but you have to wait a long time for the shudder to close after you press the snap button.  Anything that is moving...forget it because the pic will be blurry.  I regret not spending more money and getting something that is more enjoyable and easier to use.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Daniel Rivero ".:DRH:."
Reviews.Content: The camera is good for the price, you get what you pay! The camera feels cheap, you can hear the plastic crunching sometimes, but it takes pretty good photos with adecuate light. It's a good basic camera, good for kids and people who don't take lot of pictures.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Movie Lover "Dee"
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me this camera for Christmas.  We had an old Sony Cybershot which we loved for years but I wanted something light weight to keep in my purse for capturing special moments with our little one.  The photos seemed grainy on the screen but we thought it was just the way they were stored.  Unfortunately that is also the way they printed.  So disappointed in this camera.  I wish I could return it but it's been 6 months.  I plan on contacting Nikon to see what they can do for us.  I did buy this week a Kodak EasyShare C190, and I love it.

Reviews.Title: If you are looking for a great starter camera, this isn't it
Reviews.Author: CSautox
Reviews.Content: The battery life on this camera is so poor, it simple can't be used.  Fully changed batteries to dead in 38 flash photos.I love my Nikon SLR,  but would not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: U. Verma
Reviews.Content: Picture quality was good but not great. Looked actually better on computer screen than on  LCD but indoor wasn't too impressive. But can't complain for the price.

Reviews.Title: EZ Simple & resonable photo qaulity
Reviews.Author: minister for hire
Reviews.Content: EZ, simple portable. It comes with a panoramic assist plus program.  the pano program does not put a shortcut any place or in start bar so you have make a shortcut from the directory.  pics are reasonably good 90% of the time.  a great deal when i bought it for $80 each.  still a reasonable deal in the mid 100's i would say

Reviews.Title: This camera has poor image quality and lacks basic features
Reviews.Author: Matthew Bonilla
Reviews.Content: There is no option to adjust even basic functions such as image type or compression. I decided to take pictures with dimensions 3264 x 2448 and scale them down to increase quality. Yet any re-size less than 1:50 (66 x 49px) has unacceptable picture quality, and even at 1:25 (131 x 98px) one notices flaws. I cannot see how this camera could be of any use besides perhaps creating an avatar or a similarly small image. Thus I cannot recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Forget Nikon for a point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Nicole Swavely "nic"
Reviews.Content: Shortly after buying this camera there was a lens malfunction.  I sent it in and had the problem "fixed" under warranty.  Another couple months later I am having the same problem.  "Lens Error" pops up on the screen and the lens is jammed.  It is no longer covered under warranty.  I am faced with the choice of spending shipping and a repair fee, or buying another camera.  I will buy another camera rather than face the risk of yet another "Lens Error."  Such a bummer I really liked the camera, but all in all, it was a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality
Reviews.Author: Lisa Cameron-Norfleet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I each got one of these to use as our snapshot camera and we have both been very disappointed in the image quality.  In particular, both cameras produce blurry images even when the auto-focus has locked.  It's almost like the motion of depressing the shutter button causes the image to blur.He has had better luck with color and exposure than I have, but both of us have had issues with color being accurate and white/light areas being horribly over exposed.  I've used mine in a variety of conditions (outside, inside, low light, bright light, motion, stills, macro, etc) and have the same problem across the board.That said, the camera body itself feels hefty and of good quality and the controls are easy to use and intuitive.  The camera is very small and light--I carried mine around with me for months in my bag and it fits in the front pocket of a pair of jeans pretty comfortably.I really wanted to love this camera, but I just can't get past the image quality.

Reviews.Title: It works fine for low-demand photography
Reviews.Author: Smorgy "Smorgy"
Reviews.Content: I found this camera while looking for a decent point and shooter with a decent zoom and video function for less than $90. It works...Construction: It is small enough to carry in your trouser pocket, has a strap lever for a wrist strap. The USB outlet must have been designed by a lefty engineer, though, since the plastic cover has to be lifted and spun upward toward you very inconveniently.Zoom: The 3.5 zoom works fine in photo mode but a lot slower and has smaller zoom range in video mode.Manual exposure will take some getting used to. You get to adjust light exposure yourself, which helps in night photography (or when light isn't all that favorable).Color modes: come in color, vivid color, black & white, sepia.Photo: Shutter speed is on the slow side and the camera needs 2 seconds of processing before you can shoot again. The default mode has a loud shutter sound, but you can manually turn it off. Photo quality is pretty good and stands cropping well.Timer: only one mode with 10 seconds prep time for you to get in place before the camera shoots.Video mode: there's a clock shown on the screen when using the video mode telling you how much video time you have left. You can playback the video you just shot with sound. Switching between video and photo modes isn't as convenient, though, and takes at least a few seconds.The camera comes with Nikon uploader and editing program on a disc. I don't use it, though, since the Samsung photo editing program I already have on my computer works better. If you don't use the Nikon uploader you'll have to manually transfer the photos from the camera to the pc. Read the manual on it! I have to hook everything up and then restart the camera again for it to show up on 'my computer' window. Other than that, everything works fine.

Reviews.Title: Coolpix L20
Reviews.Author: little nana
Reviews.Content: It's small, light weight and easy to handle.  Takes nice pictures. I ordered it from Amazon and received it promptly in excellent condition.

Reviews.Title: Works for me
Reviews.Author: T. Helm
Reviews.Content: It does what it was purchased for.  I love the red color.  Large viewing screen that is visible in outdoor conditions.

Reviews.Title: Nice point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: PhillyFan
Reviews.Content: Nice little camera. It is very portable which makes a very nice point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Coqui Jacobs
Reviews.Content: Item was shipped promptly and so far it works great!!  It came nicely wrapped in an original container.  This seller is very very good and would buy from them again.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great price
Reviews.Author: E. Roffey
Reviews.Content: A definite upgrade from my old 3.2MP Sony.  LCD is a great size.  Now I just have to learn how to use it!

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: L. E. Thompson
Reviews.Content: This little camera is a gem, I only wish I would have had it sooner.My son has take it off to college now, so hopefully I will enjoy thephotos soon. I like the refurbished offer, as I would never beable to afford one off the shelf.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix digital camera L20 10MP
Reviews.Author: Mary L. Boughn
Reviews.Content: This inexpensive camera took excellent pictures and videos.  It is very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Sue
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera, really easy to use. I read even a child can use it so I know it would work for me.The color of the case is great even my husband doesn't mind the great red color.  Takes excellent pictures. I would recommend it to anyone.  Great price, Of course I buy from Amazon all the time.

Reviews.Title: just point and shoot!
Reviews.Author: Jeff Flis
Reviews.Content: Had an older Coolpix before this and wanted something with a larger screen and better resolution.  Got this for those two reasons only and was amazed at how the folks at Nikon have improved other aspects.  This thing makes taking photos really easy.  It's pretty hard to mess things up.  I like that, since you never know when you need to capture a moment.Compared to other cameras I've fooled with, the interface is a breeze.  I have yet to read the manual, so who knows what I am missing, but even with limited information, I'm able to get great shots.  Keep in mind that I am just using this to record my life, put stuff up on a blog, take photos for auctions I have online, and other general uses.  If you're doing stuff like this though, you can't go wrong.  Your photos will look great on both the web and printouts.

Reviews.Title: Love my camera
Reviews.Author: Norene 67
Reviews.Content: My sons gave me this camera as a gift to go with my new computer and I have already taken it on several trips. It travels easily and takes wonderful pictures (no thanks to me!). I have several scenic photos that could be mistaken for post-cards.

Reviews.Title: dougs review
Reviews.Author: Douglas D. Wicksell
Reviews.Content: For what I paid it is a great camara,I only rated what I have used to date about this product

Reviews.Title: L20 good camera
Reviews.Author: I. Duimovic "Civic Man"
Reviews.Content: The L20 camera it is a great camera for less than $90. The camera takes excellent photos during night shots. Compared with my previous cameras (Cannon, Olympus) this camera has better features for night shooting and also you have a variety of shooting options that you can try.The quality of the photo is great for a point and shot camera. It is not a SLR, so don't expect wonderful zoom quality photos. It you used the entire zoom you will loose some quality on the photo.The LCD display could have a better resolution, because at the beginning when you don't know the camera, you can thing the photo that you take came blur or that you moved the camera but no, it is just low quality on definition on the LCD screen, when you download it on you PC, you see that the photo it has excellent color and definition.It is easy to have bad photos if you don't know how to hold the camera or if your pulse is not to good, the capacity of image stabilization it not has good has the cannon but the cannon is double the price.I read on previews reviews that if you drop the camera is done, well if you drop any camera from 4FT high or more you have a high possibilities that you will loose the camera, so protect the camera as you should and you will have years of service.In conclusion if you are looking for a low budged and high quality camera for the price, you need to go for this Nikon, the lens is great and the features are much better than any other point and shot camera.

Reviews.Title: Good for the everyday user to get snapshots.
Reviews.Author: Jimm
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a present and it's very good for the user. For me it lacks features and picture quality isn't as high as I expected.

Reviews.Title: Very happy!
Reviews.Author: foudefondue "foudefondue"
Reviews.Content: Had a chance to finally use this during a weekend get-away and having not played with it at all before leaving, I was please to say I'd all but mastered the features by the time we got home!  Very easy to figure out if you're familiar with basic camera navigation.  Lots of options that are easy to get to.  LOVE the video quality... surprised, actually, by how great it is.  The pictures are great, too, for a point-and-shoot.  Compact, sturdy, and fits great in my purse.  I do recommend putting it in some kind of case or pocket or something, just to diminish scratches and nicks (display does seem prone to showing scratches).  Otherwise, very happy with the product and price!

Reviews.Title: No Warranty on LCD
Reviews.Author: L. Conway
Reviews.Content: Had the camera 2 weeks an the LCD Broke.Nikon refused to repair without a charge of more then the Camera cost new.I called Nikon & there attitude was not what I had expectedMy Nikon days are over.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Maypril
Reviews.Content: My father bought me this camera for Christmas. I was very excited to have a simple point and shoot - I have an SLR by Fujifilm, but decided to try out this Nikon camera. I was disappointed first in the picture quality. In automatic mode everything was either washed out or too dark. Then, after a couple weeks, I travelled to Mexico, excited to take new pictures with my camera and hoping these would come out better. While taking a portrait, I knocked over the camera from about a foot up and the LCD display just shattered. I contacted the company and they said this was not under the warranty. The camera does not have a viewer so I was shooting blindly for a week, hoping my pictures would not be cutting off heads. The company said the LCD would be about $80 to fix, which is almost as much as I paid for the camera. Now I have a useless camera. Definitely do NOT recommend this camera to anybody. Look for another!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!
Reviews.Author: Luigi
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. It is inexpensive, it has great flexibility and easy to use fully packed features, it looks great and most of all takes GREAT sharp pictures. You hardly need the flash, even in low light and at night the image sensitivity is excellent and easily adjustable (just have a steady hand when you take the shot in low light because the shutter tends to stay open longer and that may cause some bluriness in the picture), again; you hardly need the flash (will save battery life). Video and audio quality are also excellent and battery life is adequate. The large screen is a plus as well. Only gripe is with the SD card being inside the battery compartment which it means that you need to open the fragile battery door everytime you want to take the SD card out. Quick tip 1: keep the resolution at 5 megapixels for a regular size 4x6 photo, you can't tell the difference in sharpness between 5 and 10 mpx and you'll have twice as much storage on your card. Quick tip 2: use the camera in auto mode(more reliable), not easy mode. I invite you to read the book. this camera has many useful features (automatic color compensation, rapid shots setting, light compensation, close-up feature and many more). Overall: EXCELLENT!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: E. KIMAK
Reviews.Content: I am awful with digital cameras. For me, they always break or stop taking clear pictures. I recently purchased this Nikon to replace two Kodak cameras. The camera is easy to use and durable. The pictures came out clear. For the price you can not beat it.

Reviews.Title: its a pretty good camera...but
Reviews.Author: larry
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a client and i tried it out first,it takes great pictures when the flash is on,if off its sort of blurry but the picture is really good when the flash works,i`d still recommend it and the price is not bad too..

Reviews.Title: Exceellent digital for all different events!
Reviews.Author: K. Burns-power
Reviews.Content: I purchase this Nikon due to a friend of my daughter's(age 14), had it dropped at my daughter's bday party, and the girls responsible were able to chip in to replace....and though feeling their lumps about this.....Amazon affordable price made it workable, and positive teachable moment. The young girl who received the new camera loves it better than the original camera(Canon), due to more features and easability. So, thank you Amazon for being there in the moment!!!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: E. Rosales "e.Ro"
Reviews.Content: Love this camera! it works great and has clear sharp pictures and is easy to use and transfer pictures

Reviews.Title: Big bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Walter W. Mcgovern "River Rat"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera because Fantasea had a custom underwater case for it and I was heading to Grand CaymanThe unit takes excellent pictures out of the water and good pictures in it-Deeper you go the bluer they get - You need a $40 red filter for some  balance (or a $4/5000 pro model with an arm load of lighting gear) - Next year we will have the filterFor those complaining about out of focus, READS THE BOOK and use AUTO rather then EASY Auto

Reviews.Title: NICE!
Reviews.Author: Bruce R. Sinopoli
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera for the price. Takes great pics, very easy to use.You need to carry extra batteries if you take alot pf pics. Batteries seems to run out fast with this camera..don't know why. but overall very nice camera.

Reviews.Title: Decent quality for the price
Reviews.Author: Markus W. Germann
Reviews.Content: This is a basic camera, it shoots decent pictures for the price. Do not expect to be able to tinker with tons of settings.The viewfinder is somewhat grainy (in low light), but the pictures are displayed fine. The pictograms (menu) are coarse, then again this is a cheap camera and this does not affect the picture quality. It is however curious why this should be so. I like the AA batteries for convenience, but you can also use rechargeable AA (Eneloop).Note this is 4 stars considering the price !

Reviews.Title: Worth the money.
Reviews.Author: chris "CGHearn"
Reviews.Content: This isn't a great camera for low light shooting unless you have a really steady hand. Other than that, this camera has been great to me.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good camera for a really good price
Reviews.Author: Samantha Who "Shelly"
Reviews.Content: This is our second nikon camera and we really like it.  It's super simple to use.  The only problem we have is when taking pictures in low light, they very often come out grainy and the videos done in low lighting are a bit blurry.  The manual even says that the ISO doesn't work great in dim lighting.  Other than that, for outdoor daytime pictures or inside well lit areas, the pictures come out great.  Very easy to point and shoot and get great shots!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L20 10MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Ann J. Collins
Reviews.Content: This camera was a Christmas gift to my Grandson. He is 9. It is the perfect camera for a young pre-teen.  He was able to start taking photos as soon as he opened the gift. He was very pleased with this camera and so was I.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L20 10MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Leslie A. Skym-szymanski
Reviews.Content: Nikon does it! Great point and shoot. Well worth the money. Zoom is good. I use a Nikon D90 for most of my work but use this for quick pics on the road.

Reviews.Title: great for the money
Reviews.Author: Paul Provost "moon"
Reviews.Content: 10 megapixels-lot's of picture modes/menu selections. great battery life - and all for $95. can't really complain. replacing a 4MP canon with a worn out rechargeable battery with this and it's fine. a little bulky due to the standard AA batteries, but easily replaceable when they run out - no charging or buying expensive replacement packs.and at this price, don't really care if i loose it or drop it.you will need to buy a memory card though as it does not come with one, but those are so cheap now too.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Bobcat "Ocams fan"
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for my nephew.  It works great.  I would recommend it to a friend.  I really like the big screen size.  Good purchase,  good transaction.

Reviews.Title: Tiny But Huge
Reviews.Author: Robert Allocca "Former Food Distributor"
Reviews.Content: Tiny and lightweight but Huge in features and easy to use. It's no surprise, it's a Nikon. My second Nikon and it will not be my last.

Reviews.Title: disappointing
Reviews.Author: Ernest Ward "ncrunner"
Reviews.Content: as a longtime nikon owner (back to a and f series 35mm), and owner of a d90, this is a disappointment. serious shutter lag results in many missed photos. overall, i do not recommend you buy this camera. sorry, nikon (love my d90!).

Reviews.Title: Great buy for the price!!
Reviews.Author: Ani "ARS"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera on Thanksgiving.Its been two months now.It is a great camera for the price.Photo quality is amazing, wide range of features, easy to use and looks sleek.The video quality,however could do with some improvement.

Reviews.Title: Niko Review
Reviews.Author: Lawrence S. Hennessy
Reviews.Content: Nice camera for the kids, but the lense system jammed on two versions of the camera. Take care when handling.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix-love it!
Reviews.Author: Yooper Red Hatter
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift to my daughter & am told she loves it & uses it constantly!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Coolpix L20 10MP Digital Camera with 3.6 Optical Zoom and 3 inch LCD
Reviews.Author: Brenda G. Hall
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that was user friendly, simple to use. I purchased another brand that was too complicated to use, so I took it back and purchased this one. I liked it so well, that I purchased one for my mother for Christmas.

Reviews.Title: It's less than I expected.
Reviews.Author: R. Norman
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 11 year old son for Christmas.  I have always owned Nikon cameras, currently I shoot with a D40, but my last point and shoot was a Nikon Coolpix L6.  I was looking for something like that for my son, and found that the L20 was in my price range.  I didn't look at the camera in person.  I read a few reviews, and purchased the camera, mostly on the Nikon name, and reputation.  When my son started taking pictures with it, I was immediately disappointed in the resolution of the LCD screen.  It truly is horrible.  The supposed 10 megapixel resolution is laughable at best.  If I had it to do over again, I would have purchased the Fuji Finepix J38.  That is the camera my other son bought, and it is leaps and bounds better than the L20.Shame on Nikon for spending more on advertising with Ashton than they did on making a quality product.

Reviews.Title: great for Grandaughter
Reviews.Author: Joyce E. Stoesser
Reviews.Content: Purchased this l20 for a christmas present,for Grandaughter14 years old. She loves it! does so many different things automaticly. takes pic when person smiles,excelent pictureswhen you be sure and focus before taking pic.She took 500 pic's in three days at Christmas time.Most came out great

Reviews.Title: Great for children and first camera.
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix L20 10MP Digital Camera with 3.6 Optical Zoom and 3 inch LCD (Deep Red)

Reviews.Title: This thing is great
Reviews.Author: Peter Volkmar
Reviews.Content: A great little camera, Easy to use, lots of settings, uses AA batteries so you always have a spare. I had the L18 before and they both take a great picture. Nikon Coolpix is great

Reviews.Title: nikon l20
Reviews.Author: F. Coban-Trotman "Francesca Trotman"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a friend as she doesn't really know how to operated these type of electronics.  However, I am very disappointed with this Nikon digital camera.  The picture quality is very poor, you have to retake the shot over and over again before you get it clear. Another thing is I don't know if there is a manufacture defect with this particular camera as I tried turning on the camera for over 5 minutes before I actually got it to come on. This camera really sucks! I need to get a SLR and I'm wondering if buying another Nikon would make a difference.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift!
Reviews.Author: R. Powers "B Powers"
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera to my parents for Christmas, my mom in her late 60's. They seem to love it. They find it easy to use, although some practice needed (normal learning time). I tought them how to down load on computer and how to order prints online. It was a hit! For a more simple camera, it's a great product.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad little camera once you figure it out.
Reviews.Author: Skobeans "Mr Coffee"
Reviews.Content: This is not a high end camera, if that is what you are looking for look elsewhere. But if you spend a little time reviewing the manual and playing with it you should enjoy this compact camera.I have never had a grainy picture when I have waited for the green focus box to appear. Now, it may not appear right away in low light situations but again I did not expect it to be a perfect camera for every need at this price range.If you need extensive low light functionality spend some time looking at other cameras and reviews. You should find a good one for $150 to $200.Otherwise enjoy a good camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: It's OK
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Bought this thinking it would be a great, easy-to-use point-and-shoot for my teenage daughter.  While the modes and menu system are simple and the icons are fairy intuitive, I found this camera lacking.  Either the modes aren't quite optimized for the settings or this camera just doesn't take quality pictures I think a Nikon should.  My Canon Powershot seems to do better.

Reviews.Title: Broke after 2 months.
Reviews.Author: Jenelle Davies
Reviews.Content: I took less then 25 pictures with the camera and kept it in its on little pouch. Grabbed out one day and noticed a crack in the LCD screen, rendering it completely useless. Called up Nikon since i had a two year waranty and they told me it'll cost 120 dollars to fix. Yes, double the price I paid for it. Aside from the broken screen, the pictures where very blurry, and my LCD screen was very very grainy. Definitely not being another consumer level Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality control in production
Reviews.Author: R. Smith "photobug"
Reviews.Content: I have been both a professional photographer and a photography instructor in my past life and generally love Nikon cameras.  I currently use a Nikon D40X DSLR with great results.  This camera (the Nikon Coolpix L20) has, in my opinion, quality control problems which originate at the factory (in China).  I read the reviews before purchase but decided to buy one anyway.  Took a cruise with the L20 as my only camera (I was on vacation - right?) My mistake - I should have tried out the camera before I left - It was pretty much useless.  Out of 200 photos less than 30 were printable unless one was entering a creative art show.  I believe from the reviews I have read that many if not most of the L20's work fine, but 10 -20% are not made well and the reviews back that up.  Problems with my camera ranged from failure to read low light situations, to totally blurred photos in normal daylight. I don't hate the L20 in general - just the one I have.  I am in the process of returning it to Amazon for refund.  Next try will be an Olympus or a Canon.

Reviews.Title: THE worst camera
Reviews.Author: Kombu
Reviews.Content: It is not even 3 months. The camera is already dead. We went for a trip to NYC and Boston. After returning, we realized that it took all blurred images...No memories of the trip at all. Now it says it cannot read the memory card. The memory card is good and I can read it from the computer. Waste of money. WILL NEVER BUY ANOTHER NIKON PRODUCT.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: David Keenan "TwoDogs"
Reviews.Content: Good point and shoot starter camera, at under $100 you can't expect much but it does take very nice pictures. Great first camera!

Reviews.Title: cool camera
Reviews.Author: MedLady "music happy"
Reviews.Content: This camera is replacing a Canon Sureshot that is 10 yesrs old.  This Nikon is a lot smaller and actually is much easier to use.  The view finder is a full 3 inches which is a GREAT feature. The price could not be beat either and the color is, well, COOL! Picture quality is fine but I am still learning how to take pictures in differnt lighting. I hate to read manuals so I am learning as I go. Oh, and you do have to hold down the button 1/2way until it focuses then depress it all the way for a clear picture.

Reviews.Title: Ok, for snapshots
Reviews.Author: Heather Goodreau "Mom of Three"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift for my husband so that he can take it hiking in the ADK. It's a nice camera for that use, but not much else. As most point and shoot cameras it has a slow reaction time which is not ideal if you're trying to snap some pics of any little ones. Overall nice and worth the $80 I paid for it.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for casual use
Reviews.Author: Al from Albuquerque
Reviews.Content: In general, I'm quite pleased with Nikon cameras and was willing to buy the Coolpix L20 even though it lacked a viewfinder.  I needed a camera in a hurry to replace my Nikon 2100 that I have used for several years and the price I paid (<$100) meant I wasn't risking a lot.  I have used the camera for four months primarily for snapshots, a job it does admirably.  The 10 Megapixel resolution allows me greater enlargements than I could get with the older 2100 (2.2 megapixels).  I also use the camera for recording data of various types in place of note-taking; such as product descriptions on store labels, documents, newspaper items, etc.  Does that job fine.  The recessed on/off button solves the issue of having the camera turned on by carrying it in my pocket.  The size is convenient and power supplied by two AA batteries is an advantage.  I live in New Mexico where bright sunlight can be a problem when taking pictures out of doors - that's why I wanted a view finder.  The lack of a viewfinder is the reason I give the camera four stars rather than five.  Nevertheless I am pleased with the purchase and recommend the L20 for anyone looking for a simple point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Frequently freezes up
Reviews.Author: Mitchell A. Noble "chipmonk"
Reviews.Content: I bought this Nikon Coolpix for my daughter because I have had many good experiences with Nikon cameras. Right out of the box, it started freezing up and would not respond until the batteries had been taken out and re-inserted. Then it would take a few pictures and do it again. It was very frustrating for her. I took advantage of Amazons return policy and got a refund.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: A. A. Keller
Reviews.Content: It is a great value! Takes really nice pictures for everyday life. All the functions are easy. Has frozen a few times, needing taking out the battery to reboot. A reset button would be useful.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: C. Hicks
Reviews.Content: The L20 was a gift for my son.  His comments follow:  "I am completely satisfied with the L20.  It is easy to use and takes really good pictures.  Making short videos takes three clicks.  As a starter camera, I cannot find one fault.  As recommendations go, this receives my highest.  My name is Homer Hicks and I approve the above message!"

Reviews.Title: Good for starters
Reviews.Author: smaz
Reviews.Content: Gift to a lady who just wanted to take pictures. She says the camera works great for her and it is quite easy to use.

Reviews.Title: good basic camera
Reviews.Author: D. Tang
Reviews.Content: My 5th grade kid was the first user of the camera to camp with school; and came back with camera in excellent shape still and with many good pictures on it that included different settings and lightings.

Reviews.Title: Perfect pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Ryan Endres "ryanendres.com"
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd CoolPix camera, my last one was L17 which was destroyed by a camping mis-hap.  The L20 was a nice upgrade with bigger LCD, a bit more zoom and a couple more mega-pixels.  The only issue I've had with it is that during video play back (on the camera or watching on a PC) the video part will stop and the sound keeps going while zooming in or out.  My previous L17 didn't have this issue.Overall for under a 100 bucks I cannot complain.  Well done Nikon!

Reviews.Title: great, easy camera
Reviews.Author: steelersfan "steelersfan"
Reviews.Content: Great, easy to use camera, for day-to-day use, love the bigger screen, easy on batteries, great price.

Reviews.Title: Great for every day use
Reviews.Author: Henry Smithe
Reviews.Content: Great for taking on vacations. It's small size and low battery use make it very portable. The video quality is also impressive for a smaller camera. I had it on my car dash driving down a road at 75MPH and it captured the passing detail very well.

Reviews.Title: small and inexpensive
Reviews.Author: Wayne Casciola
Reviews.Content: For a hundred dollar camera it takes great pictures. Very small and easy to use. Great camera for weekend getaways and everyday use. It isn't a digital SLR so don't try to compare it to one. I am very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT
Reviews.Author: Ihuloa
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera and am able to see a bigger picture before snapping the picture I desire..

Reviews.Title: Really good product, Nikon has been always good
Reviews.Author: Dominican
Reviews.Content: I had the older version of this camera and the picture quality was great, it was one of the main reasons I picked Nikon again.. I think for an affordable price camera it meets all requirements and it is a grat purchase.

Reviews.Title: I really like this camera
Reviews.Author: Loretta Scott "Loretta"
Reviews.Content: I'm no camera expert, I just like to take pictures of my grandkids and my dogs and other things that happen to be there.  The pictures I've taken with this camera a wonderful and when I transfer them to the computer, they are clear, bright, crisp--just what I wanted and the price could not have been better. I am happy !

Reviews.Title: as good as they come
Reviews.Author: Macvadio
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately broke my last one after a 4' drop to cement... with the lens extended. It was a convenient, trustworthy little camera and I hated to see it go. But now after a couple of weeks with a brand new version of the coolpix (the red one), it seems even better than the last except for one thing. The memory chip access was on the outside of the case; click to remove, click to reinsert...easy and convenient. Now the access slot is inside, under the flap door next to the batteries. I CAN'T STAND IT. I transfer my pictures often to other computers at work, and frequent opening and closing of that flimsy flap of a door gives me the willys'. I cannot see this turning out well; even using extreme care.

Reviews.Title: Great Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: M.F. "Miri"
Reviews.Content: Great digital camera! Simplifies your picture taking by automatically select the best setting. Produces high quality pictures with stunning colors and sharp resolution.

Reviews.Title: Cool Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Allen Wyler
Reviews.Content: Easy to operate. Gives great snapshots. Not as good as my Nikon SLR but great for keeping in a pocket for the occasional shot you'd otherwise not get. Only negative is no viewfinder, which is useful on bright days when it's difficult to see the LCD screen.

Reviews.Title: Nikon L20 does not fit S series case shown
Reviews.Author: FW "FW"
Reviews.Content: Amazon packages other items together: camera + SDHC + caseI ordered a Nikon Coolpix L20 to replace my L12 -- damaged screen by not having a case.  When I ordered the L20, I also ordered the SDHC + case. The case is for S series.  The L20 does not fit this case.Amazon should correct this.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed with the clarity of pictures
Reviews.Author: J. Sommer
Reviews.Content: This camera was very easy to use, the only part I found difficult was the battery/photo card compartment.  The batteries pop up so when you are closing the door you have to push the batteries down with the door....feels like your going to break it.  I was very disappointed with the quality of pictures.  I don't know if maybe this is just a lemon, but the photos were blury and hazy, colors are not bright and vivid.

Reviews.Title: Ended up returning it
Reviews.Author: N. Seed
Reviews.Content: Its a nice looking camera and I wanted to like it - but the picture quality is not the best. This is my 4th digital camera (2 x point and shoot and 2 x DSLR) and its the first that I couldnt get the picture quality to be what I wanted. I ended up returning it for the Canon SD1200 and am glad I did.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera!
Reviews.Author: Wenol
Reviews.Content: The short & sweet of it is this camera for the price has great features, is easy to use. The large viewing screen is readable even outdoors in the bright sunlight. Picture quality is very good for this price range.

Reviews.Title: Love my Coolpix
Reviews.Author: Sharon Green
Reviews.Content: It was easy for me to figure out how to get started.  I was able to see pictures, that were good, quickly.  I am leaving on vacation shortly and I will really put this little gem to the test.

Reviews.Title: Bob's review of the Nikon L20
Reviews.Author: Bob Simpson "Raiderbob"
Reviews.Content: The camera was received earlier than expected and performs as I expected a Nikon product to perform.  It is very easy to download pictures to the software provided.  The camera is extremely good value and the 3" view of pictures on the back is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera, excellent value
Reviews.Author: Shop Girl "World traveler"
Reviews.Content: Small camera, fits in my cell pocket on my purse. Great for vacations!  It takes sharp, postcard like photos.  Excellent value, but....make sure you have extra batteries.

Reviews.Title: Bang for the Buck
Reviews.Author: Eric N. Dai
Reviews.Content: This computer has wonderful bang for the buck. It takes fine pictures for what I paid for it. The only drawback  I can mention is that it is a little too thick compared to other point and shoots, but you get what you pay for. It has fine scene settings and normal controls. A lack of manual controls is fine for a college student (recreational photography).

Reviews.Title: Worth the money!
Reviews.Author: no one
Reviews.Content: It is a little bit bulkier than what I had hoped for... but it does take great pictures. It has many different scenes to choose from... very user friendly. I feel like it is well worth the money... especially if you buy it used.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: G. Howze "Nikon Luver"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my son on his 28th birthday, he has been using it since he took it out of the box and totally loves it.  He is expecting a new baby in June and I am sure it will get used even more once she arrives.  The color in the pictures is great, I love Nikon!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: Cinders "Cinders"
Reviews.Content: Beware of Nikon's lens error problems.  This is the 2nd Nikon I had in a year and half.  The 2nd one Coolpix L20 only lasted two months before the big lens error.  Nikon does not stand behind there product.  They won't cover this under warranty.  They say the camera was damaged and they won't fix it unless you pay 75-80 dollars to get it fixed when you can buy a new camera for that amount.  The lens gets stuck about half way and you can't turn on the camera .

Reviews.Title: Not a great camera
Reviews.Author: History Fan
Reviews.Content: My husband got me this camera for my birthday and I really don't like it. It feels large and bulky and it's really not user friendly. What are all of these little icons and images supposed to mean?! If I have to look it up in the manual, then it's not user-friendly. The picture quality is so-so and cannot be reliable for taking a 'quick picture' as it can take a while (and a few presses) to focus.

Reviews.Title: Vacation Saved
Reviews.Author: Michael R. Neal "Mike Neal"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Nikon Coolpix Camera for Lady to take on our vacation,I also got the memory card ,this was the best investment I made for the trip. She attached the camera to a neck strap and proceeded to take 700+ photos , day time ,night time ,sunsets,sunrises and everything inbetween. The camera is easy to use and takes very clean and sharp images. I would recommed this to anyone it makes for good evenings laughing and reviewing the days events. I would strongly recommend rechargable batterys and charger. The Nikon Coolpix that we got was referbished so the price was better yet .

Reviews.Title: camara
Reviews.Author: Juan C. Sarmiento Camargo "Juan Sarmiento"
Reviews.Content: la iba  a devolver porque tiene un problema que no se puede borrar las imagenes por que se queda bloqueada, pero encontre otra forma de hacerlo y trabaja bien

Reviews.Title: Great for stills, forget motion
Reviews.Author: Sparrow28
Reviews.Content: I bought the Coolpix L20 the day it came out in February 2009, to replace my ancient Kodak.  I liked the description of the features, particularly the "Easy Auto Mode," since I sometimes found myself wanting to switch modes on my Kodak more quickly than it could handle.I have to say that I was underwhelmed.  While the modes were very good for their intended purposes (I got some amazing shots of a sunrise from the Promenade in Jerusalem while touring), the shutter speed and focus were disappointing.  Shooting pictures from a moving tour bus was impossible, and the photos I tried to take during a friend's wedding all came out hopelessly blurred.  When I tried switching to the Easy Auto Mode, the camera spent long enough deciding which mode to use that the moment was gone by the time the picture finally snapped.  Thank goodness other friends are willing to share their wedding snapshots.  I don't mean that the camera takes an extremely long time, just do not use Easy Auto Mode while trying to capture something in motion.The video capability of this camera was a really nice surprise.  With a memory card in, I could shoot up to 20 minutes of footage, consecutively or non-consecutively. For fast motion, taking a video got you a much better image than a still.The LCD of the camera was smashed in my suitcase while flying; when I called Nikon, they said  LCD replacement is not covered under warranty and it would be $80 just for parts, never mind labor.
