Goodbye Coolpix L20, it was nice knowing you. To avoid this fate, I recommend always packing this camera packed in something soft and surrounded by a rigid container.

Reviews.Title: Nikon cool pix
Reviews.Author: scooter
Reviews.Content: Service was fast, easy. As soon as I ordered it, confirmation of order and tracking # was posted to my email. It arrived just as they said it was. Great company and I definitely would trust amazon.

Reviews.Title: DON'T DROP IT!
Reviews.Author: Mr. Stephen M. Greenspan
Reviews.Content: Nikon Coolpix L20 10MP Digital Camera with 3.6 Optical Zoom and 3 inch LCD (Deep Red)My six year old dropped this camera from 3 feet onto a wood floor....The end.

Reviews.Title: Blurry Pictures
Reviews.Author: J. Reno "Daughter of the King"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my teenage daughter for Christmas.  It has taken almost all blurry pictures.  Read the reviews after I bought it and see this is a common problem.  Returning it. Would not buy another one.

Reviews.Title: LOOKS GOOD
Reviews.Author: Ronald Maddox
Reviews.Content: THE CAMERA LOOKS GOOD AND DOES A GOOD JOB, GOT IT FOR MY GRAND DAUGHTER SHE LIKES IT.

Reviews.Title: not recommended!
Reviews.Author: Menchu Cruz "Menchu"
Reviews.Content: The only reason I purchased this item was due to price affordability, other than that, i would not recommend for anyone to get this camera. First of, the picture quality was so poor, severely blurry, and the one I got the volume feature for video was not working. I returned this camera within 1 day of checking out it's feature. Luckily, the people at Amazon was accepted my return w/o any hassle. I went ahead and bought myself a much better quality digicam- CANON powershot(I could not be any happier and very satisfied w/ my new camera).

Reviews.Title: Really good, but not perfect
Reviews.Author: A. Radcliffe
Reviews.Content: I love my little red camera, but there are a few things I would improve.What I like?1. Small, compact and takes pretty clear pics.2. Takes reasonable video clips and you can hear the sounds about as well as any other camera I have had (to say not great, but you can hear).3. One had zoom, great for when you have your hands full.4. Huge display.What I would improve?1. You cannot zoom out once you start the video recording. You can zoom in more, and then back to where you started, but if you start the video in partial zoom, there is no way to go all the way back out. At least not that I have found.2. It takes a few seconds to "warm up" when you turn it on. It wants you to select your mode and then the rebound time seems fine for me (mostly taking pics of my kids).3. HATED the auto select mode, in terms of what type of pic it would take. The thing could not seem to make up its mind, so I selected the standard auto mode and now it works fine. In the camera's defense, I didn't read the manual before trying it out so I might be doing something wrong, but if I can't just point, shoot and have a good pic, I don't care. That is all fixed when you just select a picture mode - the rest of my pictures are great.

Reviews.Title: Get what you pay for....
Reviews.Author: C. Rivera
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a few months ago & am not very pleased with the quailty of the photos.  I am not a professional photog by any means, I use this for taking family photos & such.  I previously had the Canon SD400 for several years & was really happy with it until it finaly broke so upon searching for a new camera & doing all the comparisons I chose this one.  The colors are never right & sometimes blurry. Don't buy this camera!  Its cheap for a reason.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the price
Reviews.Author: John "John B"
Reviews.Content: If you just want a camera thats simple to use this is it.It`s as point and shoot as you will get.This camera takes care of red eye and also alert`s if a person blinks.

Reviews.Title: Quite disappointed
Reviews.Author: SF new dad
Reviews.Content: Improvement is definitely needed on this camera.  I was surprised to find so many problems in so little time:1. Video recording may freeze.  I had to take the batteries out and put back in to shut it down.2. PC software doesn't download some files, and just stuck there.3. Because of 2 above, I found this: No automatic shutdown.  It drained out the two AA batteries as I left it to continue downloading to my PC.4. Doesn't always respond to the shutter press.  This is very annoying, as the moment could pass in an instant.5. In review mode, going back-and-forth among pictures and deleting pictures/videos take a long time.All in all, I think you can buy a much better camera with other vendors for the same price range.

Reviews.Title: This camera makes me think twice about buying another Nikon
Reviews.Author: AY "AY"
Reviews.Content: Brought one for my mother in-law for Xmas, she keep complaining the picture looks like crap, it turns out she was maxing out on the zoom, and there is no way in this camera to turn off digital zoom. Nikon support is no help. Also the low light performance of this camera really sucks, lots of noise. Too bad Panasonic doesn't have any current model that use AA battery and SD cards, otherwise I would have gotten a Panasonic instead.

Reviews.Title: Blurry!
Reviews.Author: Melissa Tata
Reviews.Content: This is not my first digital camera. In fact, I work at an animal shelter and take pictures of the pets for the website.  So I'm not an idiot and I know how to use a camera.  This camera takes HORRIBLE pictures.  There are almost too many settings and I still can't tell the difference between them.  It blows through batteries like water (probably because it takes forever to find the right setting).  It "went to sleep" on me several times - didn't shut off, but wouldn't respond when I tried to take a photo, which caused me to miss several opportunities for shots. But most of all, when pictures of stationary objects come out blurry (and I have a steady hand) - it must be the camera.  I am taking this one back to the store!

Reviews.Title: Low Quality
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I was highly disappointed with this item.  The 5MP camera on my HTC Hero takes better pictures than this!  The images were consistently blurry, overlit, etc...  I am not a professional photographer by any means.  Just a point and click kinda guy, but I do know my way around technology.  The old adage holds true; You get what you pay for.  I will be returning this promptly for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Unbelievable that this is from Nikon
Reviews.Author: Tech Happy
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera today and it's going back to the store. There is a serious design flaw in this camera that results in unacceptably poor image quality in all but bright daylight.  Shooting indoors in the middle of the day in a fairly brightly lit room produced images that were comparable to most cell phone camera.  The problem seems to be its metering. Set to auto mode, the camera refused to flash, even though its meter was clearly telling it that there was not sufficient light.  Instead, it pushed the ISO to 800 and then dropped the shutter speed to 1/30.  The result: a drab, grainy, noisy, blurry picture ( as shooting handheld at 1/30 is likely to do).  Trying other shooting modes (including "indoor/party") did not help.  Since you can't force the camera to flash there is little one can do to compensate.  Amazingly, shooting outdoors in the shade (but with plenty of ambient light), the camera flashed when shooting a person up close, producing an over-exposed picture.  Trust me--even if you think "I'm not that picky"---you will be disappointed in this camera.  Consider other options in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Questionable Quality and Warranty
Reviews.Author: Richard Ross
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 17 year old daughter and after about a month the LCD went out.  I sent the camera to Nikon for what I thought would be a warranty repair.  They refused to honor the warranty because there was a minor ding on one corner of the camera.  I know when the camera got the ding and the LCD did not go out when that happened, so I find it very hard to believe that was the cause. If it was, then I would question the workmanship of the camera.  There are no typical signs of a busted LCD (i.e. lines or flickering).  These things will get slung around and bumped, especially by a teenager and the camera should be able to withstand that.  In addition, the repair cost was more than I paid for the camera.Bottom line, the camera is junk or Nikon looks for any excuse not to honor an obvious defect.  My other daughter's Canon A480 is working just fine and it has had a rougher life.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use…But!
Reviews.Author: Orchid Lover
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed using this camera. I purchased a package of NiMH AA batteries to use with it. After exchanging the batteries about six times the battery compartment door broke. I see by reading other reviews that this is a common problem. I'm afraid to purchase another Nikon camera.

Reviews.Title: What a waste
Reviews.Author: MissMommy
Reviews.Content: Cute? Sure. Leaves something to be desired though in the construction. The screen on this camera completely shattered 3 days after I received it. I put it in my fleece lined, jacket pocket (all by itself; there was nothing else in my pocket) I left it there just long enough to zip up my jacket and grab my hat. I took it back out of my pocket and much to my surprise, the screen was shattered. Really?? Perhaps I received a faulty one since most other buyers are raving about it but... I wasn't too happy about it regardless. It took great pics... for the few days that it did.

Reviews.Title: Flawed engineering Lens Error
Reviews.Author: kz
Reviews.Content: This camera is a piece of junk - cannot hold up to normal use...the lens mechanism is way too delicate - made from cheap plastic and breaks extremely easily making the camera nothing more than a $100 paperweight.  I got 3 days use out of it.  Will never buy Cannon consumer product again.Nikon Coolpix S600 10MP Digital Camera with 4x Wide Angle Optical Zoom with Vibration Reduction (Slate Black)

Reviews.Title: YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR....
Reviews.Author: flyingnuggett
Reviews.Content: Our previous point click camera was a Kodak but its time/life span had come and gone.  I didn't realize how good we had till we bough this one.  I researched pretty well before settling in on this one.  All my wife and I needed was a simple point shoot camera.  Well this one is HORRIBLE.  The pictures are worthless and the majority are blurry.  NEVER had the issue with the Kodak so I know its not something I did or my technique.Plain and simple, stay away from this camera.  It's worthless and the pictures are inconsistent and mostly blurry.

Reviews.Title: N/A
Reviews.Author: Christine J. Bryant "Kristen_1"
Reviews.Content: Item returned after attempts to chat with seller - Nikon Coolpix S630 12MP Digital Camera with 7x Optical Vibration Reduction (VR) Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Jet Black)

Reviews.Title: May hay got a lemon
Reviews.Author: James W. Johnson
Reviews.Content: Have used Nikons before, but this is not their usual quality.  Photos are hit and miss and flash frequently does not work when it should.  One of the worse I have had in a long time!

Reviews.Title: A portable little camera, but with good quality
Reviews.Author: Peden "Peden"
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews here and I liked most of them. The major thing wrong with the camera that I haven't quite mastered yet is the flash. I have to put it on flash mode for the pics to come out good. Otherwise the picture qualility is poor, with fuzzy or color problems. I like that it is so small, it took alittle while to figure out how the batteries go into the camera, but like most it doesn't take 4 AA's its only 2 AA's. I would recommend this camera for someone that wants a good starter camera. It has a huge screen that you can see and it does offer the blink and smile mode.

Reviews.Title: I recommend
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Ramos
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. The large 3" LCD screen makes it so easy to take pictures, just point and click. Great picture quality with easy uploads to computer.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Juan Castillo
Reviews.Content: I haven't had a chance to review the fine points of the camera. but the basics are great!

Reviews.Title: Nikon Digital Camera L20 series.
Reviews.Author: Yawo Amenyona Ahama "AYA"
Reviews.Content: ...This camera is just for Teenagers.Because, I was surprise for the low quality of the images from this brand Nikon.It's not for use in a "very important event".I purchased to use myself but I just gave it to one of my teen children.

Reviews.Title: Happy With My Purchase
Reviews.Author: K. Nordhus
Reviews.Content: It's easy to use and the picture quality is very good. So this is one purchase that I'm very happy with. I would prefer that it can with a rechargeable battery but if you keep spare batteries on hand that shouldn't be a problem.

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality - Returned camera for refund
Reviews.Author: Aaron "Regular Guy"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera as a V-Day present, from local retailer. Upon opening, it looked great and seemed easy to use, but picture quality was TERRIBLE.  Pictures are fuzzy, have "halo"-type effects, and "feel" out of focus, even when IN focus. Could see the lack of quality immediately on the (0.3MP?) LCD, and it only looked worse upon viewing on a PC.  Assumed it was a defective camera, tried to exchange, but replacement unit was -exactly- the same. Returned for refund.(My reference points for picture quality are a ~1yr-old ~$100 8MP Canon point-n-shoot, and a $45 7MP Insignia. [generic low-end, also sold as Polaroid and others] Should be very easy to meet/exceed these simple cameras. I was very surprised to see this camera bested by both.)

Reviews.Title: cheap hole in the wall camera
Reviews.Author: Michael Krieger
Reviews.Content: This is just a cheap hole in the wall camera. I've never seen such a camera that takes blurry and grainy pictures. Its well worth it to spend more money to get something that has a rechargeable battery.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: E. Labbe
Reviews.Content: I've had a Nikon Coolpix in the past and loved it, so it was natural to get another one.  The last coolpix lasted 7 years, so hopefully this one will last long.  So far, I really like it.  It was easy to take pictures and videos and the quality of the pictures were good.  I'd recommend this camera.  It's not as small as some cameras, but it's light weight and easy to use and that's important.

Reviews.Title: nikon coolpix gift
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Barr
Reviews.Content: the nikon coolpix camera is a great gift!!! very easy to use takes great pics! great product great price

Reviews.Title: blurry pictures
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Cherry "luvmymonkeys"
Reviews.Content: I was suckered into the camera by all the positive reviews..... but I'm not impressed.  All of my pictures have an orange tint and are blurry.  Unless I'm taking a picture of something not moving.  I wanted something that you could just press the button & take a picture.  With this one you apparently have to press the button "just so".  Not happy with my purchase!

Reviews.Title: Nikon L20
Reviews.Author: Paul Garland
Reviews.Content: I have an L18 too.  Also in DSLR Nikons I use a D40 and a D300.For $100- this camera is really superb.  It fits comfortably in your pocket, uses 2 AA batteries, and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Very dissapointed
Reviews.Author: S. Jeffery
Reviews.Content: Firstly..a nicely built camera, very sturdy and feels good to use.HOWEVER...I'm not sure what NIKON COOPIX L20 other reviewers have in their posession to give such rave reviews, but the one I have does NOT give clean crisp sharp images for what I expeted from a NIKON. The colours are awful, the reds and greens are too rich. I tried some simple backyard photos on a nice sunny day in AUTO MODE, I also I have tried varous test shots, close up, zoom, normal everyday point and shoots and about 2 out of 10 were worth keeping because of the poor quality.This is not what I'd expect from a point n shoot camera.Even the old 'self portrait' at arms length it totally out of focus.The best feature it has is the panoramic mode which mage a good picture with the software that came with it.Worst feature is the 3in LCD display,  it's full of 'noise', very grainy, looks like my old TV when we had an antenna problem.My previous compact camera of 5 years was a KODAK DX6430 Eayshare and the images were much much better..For $130 ...it's about the same quality as a $50 'one-time' use cameraVERY disappointed  :(

Reviews.Title: I hate this camera.
Reviews.Author: L-Dog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got this camera as a gift to take pictures of our new baby we were so happy until we used it for my baby shower we had it on "Easy Auto Mode" or whatever it's called every single picture was blurry not like someone had moved to fast it was just fuzzy I thought there was a smudge on the lense or something......boy was I wrong! I've put it in every mode it has to try and get a good picture and none of them produced a good picture, my husbands cell phone takes better pictures, I only use it to take pictures of food in the food mode which is a neat feature and we've only had this camera for a little over a year now and today it just crapped out and died for no reason we almost never use it.

Reviews.Title: Nikon Cool Pix
Reviews.Author: Nicola Jalli
Reviews.Content: Works great only downside did not realize it had batteries my bad I did not check

Reviews.Title: Doesnt work
Reviews.Author: David M. Dashner
Reviews.Content: Bought for daughter for Christmas.  Freezes up when taking pics.  not sure of return process.

Reviews.Title: A Decent Camera BUT! a poor LCD Sreen
Reviews.Author: N. Woods
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son,The camera looks very nice, with a rich dark red color, almost like a burgundy color.It takes decent pictures, and nice videos which you can playback on the camera and hear the sound which is a plus.But the LCD screen is horrible it makes everything look awful.When composing a picture, everything on the screen looks yellowish and grainy it just looks plain ugly (though when you preview the pic's it looks kinda decent).How can such a nice looking decent camera have such a poor LCD screen.  I also fiddled with the white balance but that didnt help.The camera is ok but I am returning it, because of the poor lcd screen.We've tried other cameras like the kodak which had a big beautiful bright screen but the on cam video playback has no audio.In all fairness the Nikon L20 does take decent pictures and videos which makes it  a hard choice to return it.  But I just can't accept the poor LCD screen, its not impressive at all.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLY BLURRY, UNFRIENDLY!
Reviews.Author: T. Hazlip "Skiekitty"
Reviews.Content: I'm not exactly "camera savy", so, when I saw that it had minimal buttons and a decent zoom, I figured that this would be a good upgrade from my Kodak Z612.  Boy was I wrong!  This thing is HORRIBLE!  I cannot get a still picture if I zoom in while in "inside" mode, so if I want to take a picture of a friend while in a restaurant, I have to put it in the "Flower" mode, then the camera won't take the picture because it's too dark!  I hate this camera and will be taking it back to the place of purchase!  Don't waste your money!  It's NOT a simple camera and the zoom, while looks impressive while in zoom mode, once it snaps, it goes major blurry, so I guess it wants a tripod!  Also, it'll corrupt pictures on larger flash memory cards (I have a 32gig and, after trying to take 20 pictures and 1 2-minute video, it said that memory image was corrupt!  UGH!!).

Reviews.Title: NOT good images!!
Reviews.Author: J. dodds "judemeister"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for someone that doesn't have a need/desire for accurate color representation or nice range of values interior or exterior.The inside shots are grainy, 'noisy' and dull.  The outdoor shots are over saturated (greens are horribly distorted, turn out charteus or neon - see 'customer images'.  I've added 2 examples), but the parts of images in shadows are under saturated and dull.This happens w/ all the cameras I've tried (3) of this type - the compact 'pocket' cameras.  It must be due to the smaller lens and/or sensor.  Not sure, but not a camera for anyone that has an eye for color/detail.

Reviews.Title: Angry.
Reviews.Author: Holiday
Reviews.Content: I'm so angry right now. Just days ago, I had it priced out, that I could buy this camera, a memory card, and a case for it, all for less than a hundred bucks. In DAYS, you raise the price of the camera alone to over $100? That's ridiculous. I was planning on buying this with my next paycheck, but I'm definitely not going to now. How can you keep raising the price by $20 EVERY DAY?! No thanks.

Reviews.Title: Not a toy
Reviews.Author: George Betteridge
Reviews.Content: Nikon L20:  Very attractive. Easy to operate, usesAA. Batterys. Takes good pictures.  If you are looking for a high quality camera look elsewhare.  If you want an easy to operate beautiful camera for the youngster or student this is your camera.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Kevin McIntyre
Reviews.Content: Although I did not purchase this camera from Amazon( Best Buy), I returned it after 1 day of using it. I purchased Nikon because of my previous experience years ago with a Nikon SLR, which produced great pictures.This camera is a joke....nearly every picture I took was blurry. I purchased this for my wife for her birthday. She was extremely disappointed with it as well. When I returned it to Best Buy, the clerk told me that they have had many, many returns of this camera. I then purchased a Kodak camera (m340), and we could not be more pleased with the quality of the pics and the ease of use.....no more Nikon for me.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: M. Brown "The Tiki Room"
Reviews.Content: I'm a Nikon owner from back in the film days (Nikon FA - it's a tank...has fallen in rivers, down mountainsides, been in deep snow, a real Indaiana Jones-type camera, know what I mean?). Love the brand. Figured the newer digital cameras would be worthy of the name.GOODNESS:WOW. The digital hi-res pix this model takes are awe-inspiring. They look better than reality, if that's possible.A definite A plus on image quality, and the larger viewscreen helps too.Can do almost anything but slice and toast your bagels.BADNESS:The large viewscreen is very dim in even normal outdoor light, and dern near invisible at the beach or at a snowy street scene. You have to guess a lot, which is the whole reason I wanted to go to digital photos in the first place, so I wouldn't miss a shot and hope it came out later, like we all did/do with film.Keeping the focus motor running, the viewscreen lit, and all the other stuff this thing does EATS batteries. You will leave a trail of AA's everywhere you go. If you think you're going to be all green and cool and use recyclables, you'll wear out a full charge in less time than you think, and wind up buying several sets so that one is always charged and ready to go. I'm just sayin'...If you drop the camera while it's on, you're dead. It's that simple.If the camera is OFF (with the lens IN), you've got a chance. If you even jostle it really hard with the lens out, screw you, pal. My teenage daughter, through extreme care, actually made one of these last two years. I borrowed it for an afternoon, and managed to drop it with the lens out. On the sidewalk. I'm not the only person I know who's had this happen, either. Nikon, if they talk to you, will tell you it costs about 150 dollars to repair this, plus maybe shipping.You actually can repair it yourself for less by doing the following:  A: Remove batteries.  B: Remove memory card.  C: Throw camera in trash or bust it open with a rock (to see how it's made).  D: Buy a new one from Amazon (usually for a lot less than $150).See how easy and simple it is to solve problems, now that we're living in the future?Shame on you, Nikon. I really expected a LOT more, design-wise.I got an idea for you suits at the corporate office: why not be all Japanese and make the camera body and lens train out of origami next time? Rice paper is probably sturdier than your current lens mounting system, come to think of it. I'm just sayin'...

Reviews.Title: Nokia Camera
Reviews.Author: P. Pitkin
Reviews.Content: Got the camera in good time, in good condition.  It was used and arrived as represented in the advertisement.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy!
Reviews.Author: Jessica L. Doll
Reviews.Content: I ordered this item and quickly found out that it produces extremely fuzzy pictures.  At first I thought my hand just wasn't steady but every picture I took with it produced the same product.  I sent this item back and would not recommend this item to anyone.  This camera is cheap because it is cheaply made.

Reviews.Title: No Memory Card - Bad Tech Support
Reviews.Author: Rachel Farr
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 Nikon Coolpix for my kids -- different models.  One came with everything.  This one had no memory card.  The boxes and the manuals have the same kind of language about memory cards, but one came with and one didn't.  I called Nikon and the guy said that because Nikon doesn't make memory cards, it didn't come with it.  Nikon doesn't make batteries either, but it came with batteries.  And it doesn't explain wihy the other came with the card.  Then he hung up on me.  OK, a memory card isn't expensive, but still, this wasn't right.

Reviews.Title: Want to Return this Nikon Camera, Please Advise...
Reviews.Author: Lisa A. Quintanilla
Reviews.Content: This camera does not stay charged, constantly error message: Batteries Exhuasted!  I want to return this camera, Please advise.LQ

Reviews.Title: didnt get my order
Reviews.Author: Ingrid Vela "ingrid vela"
Reviews.Content: please i didnt get my order it was a christmas present ,please send it as soon as possible

Reviews.Title: Does no support memory card listed in manual
Reviews.Author: Gad
Reviews.Content: Returned the camera. It does not support the San Disk 4GB card that is listed as supported in the manual. Does not support Transcend 4GB card as well(listed as a "buy together" on the Amazon page). Nikon support said the camera is faulty. Either Nikon does not have a tight process for quality control or this new camera model has a design flaw. Not going to buy Nikon products again.

Reviews.Title: bad service
Reviews.Author: rene
Reviews.Content: I do not think it has a good comment, the purchase is made one months ago and the product still does not have in my hands due to an error from UPS, so I ask that my case be reviewed

Reviews.Title: Not in Stock
Reviews.Author: S. E. Lehman
Reviews.Content: This was not a good experience. The camera was not in stock eventhough Amazon said it was. Calumet Photographic said it would tellAmazon to issue a refund, but it was weeks before I received a refund.I believe most of the problem was caused by Amazon and not CalumetPhotographic. Amazon's refund policy is ridiculous.
